column1: length ball, a tiny bit of swing in towards middle and leg, Gunathilaka clips it away to long leg to get off the mark
length ball slanting across the left-hander, pitching just outside off and continuing to angle away. Karunaratne leaves it alone
good length again, the line is closer to off stump. Defended off the front foot towards backward point
fullish on off stump, straightens into the left-hander slightly. Clipped away to long leg

down the leg side, and Paul Reiffel turns down a huge appeal for caught behind. It's full and swinging further down leg, and Gunathilaka has a little flick at it - did he get an edge on it? There's a noise, certainly... South Africa have chosen not to review, and they might regret it. A spike shows up on Ultra Edge.
compensates with a full one outside off, and Gunathilaka leaves it alone

nice length to start, fullish, and fairly wide - fifth-stumpish. Makes Karunaratne play - comes forward and looks for a push into the covers. Thickish outside edge runs away to the left of gully for four
good length again, on off and middle this time, played cautiously towards midwicket
short of a good length outside off, left alone

ooh! Zips past the outside edge, and wasn't too far away at all. This went off the pitch. Pitched within the line of the stumps, and made Karunaratne play - Steyn's stock delivery would have straightened into off stump, but this one nipped away off the pitch. Didn't go at it with hard hands, though, and that's why he survived
fuller, on off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length angling across to off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball close to off stump, defended into the cover point region - Bavuma moves like a flash from backward point to cut it off

fullish, close to off stump, no swing at all and at a gentle pace. Drives it nicely down the ground, to the left of mid-off, prioritising control over power. Let it come to him and just eased it into the gap

And the very next ball stops on the batsman, but the line is middle-stumpish. Clipped to the left of mid-on, but it hung in the air for a while, made some South African hands go up towards their heads

short, just a touch of width, goes back and across and chops it nicely to the right of backward point. This outfield is very slow, and the ball comes to a stop three-quarters of the way to the boundary
stays back to a length ball angling into off stump, clips it with the angle to midwicket, who seems to have moved in a few yards after that ball that Gunathilaka chipped in the air
length ball outside off, wide enough for Karunaratne to leave confidently despite the inward angle and hint of shape into him
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-off
short now, on off and middle, pulled to square leg
lovely length, angles across to off stump. Good stride forward to defend into the off side
nice length again, a hint shorter than the previous ball and angling a touch wider. Draws Gunathilaka into a defensive push slightly away from the body, into the cover point region
back of a length, close to off stump. Karunaratne watches it well and leaves it, trusting the angle across him
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra-cover. Looks like mid-off has moved there - wider and closer to the batsman
full, angles into leg stump, and Gunathilaka flicks it away off his toes, in the air but into the gap to the left of midwicket
beauty. Angles it into a fifth-stump line and gets it to leave the batsman off the pitch. Comes forward to defend, playing for the angle, and the ball zips past his outside edge
back of a length, angling into off stump. Gunathilaka goes across and looks to work it into the leg side, gets a thick inside edge into his thigh pad
length ball on off stump, defended into the point region
full, starts outside leg and swings further down. Gunathilaka flicks at it but it's too far away from him to connect
length ball slanting across to a fourth-stump line and straightening slightly. Doesn't straighten enough to make the batsman play
shortish, a bit of width, and Karunaratne gets on his toes to punch it away into the big gap in the covers. Slows down as it nears the boundary, however
once again shortish, not as much width this time. Stops on him slightly as he plays that punch again, and it hangs in the air for a while this time, but once again into that big gap
ooh, a bit of movement now, away from the left-hander off the pitch. Again on a similar shortish length, and Karunaratne jabs at it, away from his body, and is lucky he doesn't get an edge on it
fuller now, fourth-stump channel and angling further away, left alone
good length, and nice carry through to the keeper, at around chest height, after Karunaratne leaves it. Pitched on a fifth-stump line and straightened inwards slightly
back of a length, angling away from off stump, left alone
back of a length, straightens a bit, but only straightens into Gunathilaka's hip. Tucks it away neatly to the fine leg boundary

shot! That's a good-length ball, not anywhere near a half-volley, but it gives him a bit of width, and he plants his front foot forward and slaps it away with a wristy flourish to the right of short extra-cover
fuller and just as wide, Gunathilaka stretches out to defend to short extra. The leave would have been a better option, perhaps
fullish, fifth-stump line, driven firmly to mid-off
this time Gunathilaka leaves it. Good length, again slanting across into that fifth/sixth-stump channel
good length, closer to off stump. Defends with soft hands, and it rolls off the outside half of the bat into the gap between second slip and gully
back of a length, pitching on middle and angling towards off. Gets nicely back and across to block it back towards the bowler
nice length, a little fuller and a little wider than the previous delivery, and it carries to de Kock at chest height after the batsman leaves
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
back of a length again, on middle and off, gets behind it to work it into the square-leg region
ooh, there's the first bouncer of the day, and de Kock has to reach well above his head to collect it. Angles across the batsman and rises steeply, and he sways his upper body away from the line
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the on side
starts with a good-length ball pitching on off stump and slanting across with the over-the-wicket angle. Left alone
back of a length, ends up closer to off stump this time. Karunaratne gets back and across and defends back down the pitch
ooh! Back of a length now, nips away after pitching close enough to off stump to make Karunaratne play. Jabs at it away from his body, and the ball beats his outside edge
shorter now, and Karunaratne has a little more time to get back and across and punch through the cover point region
length ball angling across to off stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length, angling into a fourth-stump line. Plays with soft hands to keep his defensive shot down in front of gully
and you can see why he has that field. Lovely length, pitching on off stump, and it nips away - looks like the offcutter, and it beats Karunaratne's hesitant poke

whoa, I'm not sure he was in any sort of control here. Bangs it in short, and it gets up towards Karunaratne's back shoulder. He has to work against the angle with that pull/hook, and contend with long leg and deep square leg on the boundary. He manages to get it into the gap and clear the rope
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
another bouncer, this one is quicker and sharper and keeps climbing on the batsman, over his left shoulder. Does well to evade this one, and not get drawn into another hook
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, defended towards mid-off
good length, starts on fourth stump and slants further away. Left alone
shortish, not quite a pulling length, and Gunathilaka's attempt at that shot, from just outside off stump, goes off the inside half of the bat, but into the gap to the left of mid-on
back of a length outside off, defended into the covers

gone! Beautifully bowled, in the channel outside off stump, with some extra bounce from just back of a length. Played away from his body there - which isn't a great idea when all you're attempting is a defensive push - and it takes the outside edge, close to the shoulder of his bat, through to de Kock

And he pops his first ball to that man at short leg! Not much of an appeal, so I'm guessing it's straight off thigh pad. Back of a length, angling into the batsman's legs, and he looked to flick with the angle. Straight off the thigh pad, nowhere near the inside edge
a little fuller, on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers
shortish, doesn't bounce as much as Karunaratne expects. Just about waist high on middle stump and he watches it well to play a controlled pull out to deep square leg
ooh, some inward movement. Stays back to one that pitches on the shorter side of a good length, and looks to flick without getting across. Beats his inside edge and hits thigh pad
good length, fifth-stump line, left alone. De Kock collects over his head
short now, targeting the batsman's ribs. Steps neatly across and tucks it to long leg
another sharp bouncer, rising over middle stump. Karunaratne ducks quickly to get under it
fullish on off stump, defended back to the bowler. Fairly quick to start

much slower and loopier, on middle stump. Pitches much fuller than he'd like, and he gets his front leg out of the way and eases it down to long-off. Surprised that fielder is back on the boundary so soon

big lbw appeal straightaway! Lovely length outside off, dips and turns to beat the inside edge of Karunaratne's forward defensive, but the impact was probably outside off stump. Impact in line, says ball-tracking, but umpire's call on whether it would have hit leg stump
sees him stepping out and bowls it full, at his feet, clipped down to long-on
quickish length ball on middle and leg. Keeps his front pad away from the line while defending
good follow-up, slower, flightier and wider outside off. Defended towards backward point
shortish, a bit of width, and Karunaratne punches it away - he's played that shot well all morning, and he finds the gap to the right of cover point
back of a length, fourth-stump line, defended into the point region

Dug in short, angling into the batsman's body and rising over his front shoulder. His lower body wants to jump and his upper body wants to duck, and he just manages to evade it. That's what a good bouncer does
ooh, extra bounce again. Angles into the fourth-stump channel and takes off from a shortish length. Looks to defend and it flies up off the shoulder of his bat, between second slip and gully
back of a length on middle and leg, defended into the on side
shortish, angling into middle stump, defended back to the bowler
full, flighted ball on leg stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
down the track now and he skips away from the line to get into the perfect position to drive this leg-stump ball inside-out, lofts it silkily over the wide mid-off region
fullish on middle stump, defended solidly off the front foot
pretty flat this time, on middle and leg and quite full. Defended back to the bowler. He's been very conscious of keeping his front pad away from the line of the ball
fires this one full, at Dhananjaya's feet, perhaps expecting him to step out. Looks to flick it away but misses, and it hits his foot on the half-volley, well outside leg stump
flights this one outside off, and Dhananjaya plays slightly away from his body in defence. Outside edge rolls away to the left of backward point
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended towards cover point
a touch fuller, on off stump, and Dhananjaya stays back to it again, defends towards cover point
back of a length, looks to angle it into middle stump, probably, but ends up slanting it slightly down leg. Looks to flick and misses, and is hit on the pad
length ball close to off stump, comes forward and shows the full face to ease it to the right of mid-off. Doesn't go too hard at it
back of a length, slanting across towards off stump, defended into the point region
flighted ball on off stump, Maharaj has to dive to his left to prevent the driven single to long-off
full again, on leg stump this time. Gets his front pad out of the way and jabs it firmly back to the bowler
tossed up slower, on off stump, driven to long-off
nice flight outside off, dips on Karunaratne slightly as he steps out of his crease. Wanted to clip that to long-on, I think, ends up playing it towards midwicket instead
flat on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler

whoa, there's the first sign of extravagant turn and bounce. Back of a length, pitches on middle, turns towards off, and just takes off, de Kock taking it over his right shoulder after the ball beats Dhananjaya's hurried back-foot defence
short, rising ball angling across the left-hander. Jumps off the ground and defends towards backward point
back of a length on off stump, punched to the right of mid-on
short ball, gets up to chest height. Dhananjaya pulls it hard, and hits Markram on the right shoulder at short leg. He barely flinches, though

ooh, extra bounce this time. Digs it in shorter than the previous ball, and Dhananjaya is hopping, lifting his hands almost involuntarily to protect himself as this climbs high over off stump. Hits the handle of his bat, I think, and pops up into the leg side, but drops just out of Markram's reach as he dives to his left from short leg
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
wide length ball, seventh-stump line, left alone
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
full on off and middle, defended back to the bowler
full on middle stump, a bit of flight, driven back to the bowler
full again, and flat, on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
much better length this time, some dip on a line close to off stump, and sharp turn away from the left-hander to beat his outside edge as he stretches out to defend
follows it up with a bad ball, short on off stump, and Karunaratne pulls it to the right of deep backward square leg
down the track and he fires it quick at his feet. Flicks it hard into the ground and it pops up towards midwicket
full and flat again, on leg stump. He's expecting Dhananjaya to step out every ball. Squeezed back down the pitch, towards the bowler
flat, back of a length, going with the angle towards off stump. Looks to cut, but he was playing for the turn, and has to adjust to the lack of room and jab it back towards the bowler
full on middle and leg, driven back down the ground and Maharaj dives right to stop it
tossed up much slower, on off stump, defended towards short extra
nice length, quickish, angling into off stump. Goes with the arm and he defends off the front foot, making sure his pad is nowhere near the line
tossed up full on off stump, gets forward, keeps his front pad away from the line, and opens his bat face to play that to backward point
good length, pitching on off stump and spinning away. Defended into the point region
tossed up slow, close to off stump, driven down to long-off

gone, that's an absolute beaut! He'll have to thank Maharaj a little for that dismissal too - Dhananjaya has been so mindful of the lbw that he's been hesitating to get his front foot across. Shamsi floats this one across the right-hander, gets it to dip on a line fairly wide of off stump. Dhananjaya looks to drive into the covers, against the turn, without getting a good stride across, and leaves a big gap for the ball to turn through and crash into off stump. Lovely, lovely delivery
nice length, close to off stump, Mendis gets a good stride forward to defend back towards the bowler
shuffles across to a good-length ball turning in towards off stump, clips it to short leg
full outside off, gets forward and uses his wrists to drive that with the turn to long-on
full on middle stump, gets nicely forward to drive to mid-on
he's been using that floaty leg-stump yorker quite often, and it dips suddenly on Mendis, who quickly pulls his front leg out of the way to clip through square leg
full on off stump, driven to long-off

floats this one down the leg side, and Mendis, looking to sweep, can't connect - or has he? The umpire thinks so. If so, it was the merest tickle past the keeper's gloves, to bring up 2000 runs in Test cricket
full on off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
whoa, sharp turn again. Was short and close to off stump, a definite line and length for cutting, but he had to abort his shot when he saw just how much it turned, after stopping on the pitch
fuller now, driven to short extra-cover
full outside off, looks to stab that through cover point, ends up slicing it off the outside half of the bat to backward point
stays back to a length ball pitching on off stump, defends with the turn into the cover point region
down the track and he gets to the pitch of this flighted off-stump ball and drives it to long-off
low full-toss floated up outside off, driven with a strong bottom hand to long-on
floated up slow on middle stump. Gets his front pad out of the way as he comes forward to defend with an open face to backward point
quicker, on middle and leg, clipped to the man at short leg, Markram, who stays low to stop it
tossed up just outside off, driven to short extra-cover
there's the Kusal Mendis sweep. Leg-stump line, but the length was probably too full for the shot. Ends up yorking himself and just about jamming his bat down on top of the ball
flighted ball on off stump, driven inside-out to the left of extra-cover
lovely length outside off. Karunaratne gets forward and across to defend and it dips and turns to hit inside edge and then pad
long-hop, pitching on middle and leg and turning down leg. Stays slightly low, so Kusal crouches a little as he pulls this away to the backward square leg boundary
flighted ball on middle stump, gets forward and flicks this hard but straight to short leg. Smacked his left shinpad on the full
tossed up again, on middle and leg, clipped to the right of midwicket
flat, back of a length, doesn't turn and keeps going with the angle down the leg side. Karunaratne can't connect with the flick
there's the wrong'un. Tossed up nice and high, dips onto off stump, maybe a touch fuller than he'd like. Defended into the on side, off the inside half of the bat
flat on off stump, goes back and stabs it with the turn to backward point
tossed up slow on off stump, driven inside-out to the left of extra-cover
down the track now, gets close to the pitch to clip this from outside off to the man at long-on
shortish outside off, Mendis goes deep in his crease to slap this away to the left of Bavuma at a deepish cover point

full, flighted ball on middle stump. Gets his front foot out of the way to drive to the left of the fielder who's just moved back from silly point to a short mid-off, right next to the pitch. He makes the diving stop
beauty. That's the length he wants to hit consistently. Draws Mendis forward in front of off stump and beats his defensive bat with dip and turn
and he ends the session with a flighty full-toss. Mendis sends it to the midwicket boundary, clearing his front leg and just swatting it away
short, a bit of width, slapped away to the right of the sweeper at deep cover point
flight and dip on middle and leg, defended into the on side
flat length ball turning away after starting outside off, left alone
closer to off stump this time, Karunaratne presses forward and defends back towards the bowler
full on off stump, driven hard to the right of the bowler, who dives to stop it
length ball on middle stump, a little slower, gets forward and defends with the turn into the point region
back of a length on off stump, gets nicely behind it to defend into the on side
length ball on off stump, lets it come on and plays it with a straight bat to the right of midwicket

fullish, slanting away from off stump, and that's nicely controlled to bring up Sri Lanka's 100. Doesn't get that much of a stride forward or across, but his head is nicely over the ball to steer it with an open face to the right of backward point
bouncer, Karunaratne ducks safely under it

ooh, gloves it. Another short ball, this one gets up to shoulder height just outside leg stump. Swivels to hook, only gets some glove on it and manages to elude the outstretched glove of de Kock diving to his right
short now, on off stump, pulls this nicely down to deep square leg, rolling his wrists over at impact
short, wide, slapped to sweeper cover
back of a length, turning in from off to middle. Stays back and defends towards short leg
sharp turn, but it turns down the leg side after pitching on leg stump. The length is good, drawing Kusal half-forward, but the line isn't, and he can't connect with the flick
tossed up outside off, similar line to the one that dismissed Dhananjaya. Kusal gets a good stride out, however, and drives to extra-cover

what happened there? Kusal drives away from his body at one floated up outside off. Dips on him and he ends up inside-edging it hard, into the ground. Markram catches it in his midriff at short leg, and some of the South Africans begin celebrating, thinking it went to him on the full
fuller, on leg stump, clipped to backward square leg
full on off stump, shows the full face to punch it back to the bowler

length ball close to off stump, Karunaratne presses forward and pushes it wide of mid-off with soft hands and brings up an excellent half-century. He's looked in control right through, apart from a couple of plays and misses at a wider line
short outside off, steep bounce, left alone
length ball angling into middle stump. Kusal's initial movement was forward and across, and he had to play around his front pad to clip that square
looks for the yorker, gets a bit of late shape in towards middle stump. Gets his front leg out of the way and clips to midwicket
short, angling across the left-hander, and that's a gorgeous shot, gets right on top of the bounce - which is only chest high - and pulls from outside off stump to the midwicket boundary
back of a length, pitching on leg stump and spinning down the leg side, sharply past the attempted flick
nice length, flighted ball pitching just outside off. Gets a good stride forward and clips it with the spin to midwicket
nice length again, on middle stump, clipped off the front foot to backward square leg
full outside off, defended with the turn to midwicket
tossed up nicely on middle and off, clipped away to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, presses forward to defend into the covers
back of a length outside off, stands tall and punches it to the left of Bavuma at cover point

gone, that's No. 420! Not quite the way Steyn must have envisioned getting it. Fullish, angling into middle stump, and it stops on the batsman. Mendis looks to flick, ends up chipping it in the air, giving mid-on the dolliest of dollies
Steyn greets him with a bouncer, rising steeply over off stump. Mathews ducks under it, a little stiffly, bending at the waist but not at the knees
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length, fourth-stump line, and Mathews, typically, shuffles across and clips it to midwicket
back of a length, a little wider now, defended into the point region
shortish, turning from middle and off to outside off, goes deep in his crease and works it into the leg side, too close to midwicket for the quick single
back of a length, a touch too straight, tucked off the hips to long leg
full and flighted on middle and leg, driven inside-out to mid-off
flat length ball close to  off stump, makes Karunaratne hurry to stride forward and defend
nice length, some flight too, pitches on middle and leg and turns towards off. Defended back towards the bowler, making sure his front pad is out of the way
full on middle stump, driven to mid-off

oh man, he gets into a really awkward position here, Mathews. Short ball, but nowhere near the bouncer that Mathews thought it was. He was jumping and taking his eye off the ball, and it ended up bouncing only waist-high. Somehow uses his wrists to keep it down on the on side
back of a length close to off stump, shuffles across to tuck it to midwicket
short again, on off stump, Mathews pulls it round to long leg, meeting it well in front of his body
nice, fullish length, slanting away from the left-hander's off stump and drawing him into a defensive push away from his body. Controls it pretty well in the end, into the covers
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
fuller now, close to off stump, defended solidly back to the bowler
nicely played. Goes back to one that's just a fraction short of a good length, outside off, and cuts it with the turn, but backward point moves alertly to his left and dives to stop it
full on leg stump, and that's a half-chance put down by short leg. Got on the front foot and flicked it to Markram's right hand, but he couldn't quite hold on

another anguished shout from the bowler after beating the inside edge with his wrong'un. Dips onto a lovely length outside off as he comes forward to defend, and hits the front pad, but impact was well outside off

ooh, he's beginning to settle into a testing length here. Tossed up invitingly on leg stump, and Karunaratne looks to flick. Closes his bat face early and the ball pops up towards mid-on, off the leading edge
pitches this one on off stump and he stretches out to defend with an open face, into the point region
fuller and flatter, driven firmly to mid-off

and he strikes with the first ball of his spell. What a delivery, too. Perfect length, perfect line in the fourth-stump channel. Mathews is half-forward, playing for the inward angle, and the ball straightens and kisses his outside edge through to de Kock. Beautiful
Rabada greets him with a bouncer, angling slightly down leg. Roshen ducks safely underneath

gone, two in three balls! This is sensational bowling from Rabada. Digs it in short, gets it to rise to around shoulder height, on off stump. Roshen fends at it in defence, with hard hands, and the inside-edge is taken splendidly at short leg by Markram, who falls backwards as it comes to him at pace, at chest height
back of a length, angling across the left-hander towards off stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length again, homing in on the top of off stump. Again Dickwella defends, showing the full face and sending it back into the V
short, wide, slapped, but there's a man sweeping at deep point to keep it down to one

that's not the smartest shot to play first up. Dickwella loves the sweep, but this is the googly, and he doesn't pick it. His pad was in line with the stumps, but it bounced extra, hit his glove, and then his helmet, sending the neck protection flying off the back of it
tossed up outside off this time, gets forward to defend
goes for the sweep again, this time against a quickish ball well outside off. Doesn't connect at all
back of a length, turns away from off stump, stabbed away towards deep point

ooh, beauty. Not sure Karunaratne picked the wrong'un. Lovely flight, and it dipped onto a threatening length just outside off before spinning in with sharp bounce. Karunaratne, however, was defending with soft hands, and the ball dropped down softly into the leg side off the inside edge

given! Rabada is on fire here. Dickwella has reviewed, however. He was playing across his front pad there... This one's angling across the left-hander from over the wicket, and it beat the outside edge as Dickwella closed his bat face early, looking to clip through wide mid-on or midwicket. Hit the back pad, and it looked like it was heading towards off stump. Was it full enough to pitch in line? Nope. It pitched outside leg stump, and Rod Tucker has to overturn his lbw decision

oh man. Dickwella is really on edge here. Digs this in short, and Dickwella ducks hurriedly, only halfway, and ends up heading the ball with the top of his helmet. Ouch. Took his eye off it, and it may have bounced less than expected - or he simply didn't read the length right
back of a length on middle stump, defended into the on side
back of a length outside off, and that's nicely played, opens his bat face to steer it through backward point
another bouncer, rising over Karunaratne's back shoulder. He thinks of hooking, and decides against it at the last moment
full, too straight, clipped off the toes to the fine leg boundary

there's that Dickwella sweep again. Goes hard at it, at a flighted length ball outside off, and is early on it. Top-edge flies over the keeper, and slip, stretching out and leaping to his right, can't get his fingertips to it either
tossed up outside off, gets a nice stride out and eases a drive to the right of extra-cover
full, in the blockhole almost, on leg stump. Gets his feet out of the way and clips to mid-on

gone, that's a sensational catch from de Kock! Or is it? Umpire Reiffel is unmoved. South Africa have reviewed this. Lovely flight and dip close to off stump, and Dickwella doesn't get a proper stride in, is drawn to defending well in front of his body. Sharp turn and bounce, and it's beaten the outside edge by a distance. De Kock took that beautifully, turning side-on to take it with both hands near his left shoulder

ooh, Shamsi has settled on a beautiful length in his last two-three overs. Pitches leg, misses off narrowly. Flight, dip, turn, bounce, beats Dickwella's forward defensive comfortably. Again, barely any forward stride
when in doubt, sweep, even if it means sweeping a full ball off middle stump. That's Dickwella's philosophy against spin. Manages to middle it to the man at deep backward square leg
back of a length, fifth-stump line, defended to point
back of a length, angling into middle and off, clipped away through midwicket
short, gets up to shoulder height on off stump. Swivels and rolls his wrists over to play a superbly controlled pull out to deep square leg

Another bouncer, rising over middle stump, and not rising particularly high. This inconsistent bounce makes the bouncer such a weapon. Karunaratne compresses himself into the smallest of targets, crouching super-low, and manages to get under it
loses control of this one, slants it waaay outside off stump, and the umpire signals wide

short, a bit of width, and Karunaratne uses the angle across him and plays a nicely controlled square-cut past the man at backward point. With a quicker boundary, he might have been batting on 85 by now
short again, this time it stays slightly low, chopped down to backward point
shortish, lots of width, takes a big step back and across and plays a deft late-cut to the right of backward point
nice length, pitching on off and turning away, stretches out to defend into the covers
too much turn, I think. The wrong'un, and it cramps Karunaratne for room as he goes back and across to work it into the leg side. Not the biggest of lbw appeals, he knew it was going down leg
another googly, pitching outside off, defended into the covers
lovely length on off stump, draws him forward to defend into the on side

short, pitching on middle stump, and it deserved to be pulled to the boundary, but it spun more sharply than Karunaratne may have bargained for, and beat his bat easily. May have also stopped on the pitch - it looked like he was early on the shot
shortish, angling in and attacking the batsman's midriff, defended into the on side
shortish on middle and leg, tucked away to long leg
full on middle and leg, jabbed hurriedly to midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped away elegantly to the left of midwicket
bouncer outside leg, Karunaratne ducks under it
length ball on off stump, lets it come to him and eases it into the gap to the right of extra-cover
tossed up wide of off stump, Karunaratne gets a big stride across to play that to backward point, with an open face
very full on off stump, jabbed back towards the bowler
lovely. Draws Karunaratne forward again to play that wide line, but this one dips and drops much shorter than the batsman expects and spins past the outside edge
line slips down the leg side now and Karunaratne sweeps to the right of the fielder at deep backward square leg
length ball on middle and leg, defended towards mid-on
down the track, ends up almost yorking himself off a fairly quick one on off stump. Clipped to midwicket
nicely flighted outside off, turns in from a good length. Defended into the on side
a bit fuller and Dickwella gets forward to drive with the turn to long-on
nicely played. Saw this was slower, with more flight, outside off, and stretched out quickly before waiting and scooping it with the turn into the fine-leg region
quicker now outside off, saw Karunaratne looking to step out, defended into the covers
more flight now, outside off, driven to sweeper cover
tossed up even wider, and Karunaratne gets a good stride in to drive against the turn, squarer than the previous one, to the right of extra-cover
lovely flight again, on leg stump, opens up Dickwella and makes him play across the line, looking for wide mid-on. Dips and turns to find the leading edge, rolls into the covers
superb, beats the outside edge this time. Dip and turn again, this time outside off, and Dickwella's lack of a front-foot stride makes him play a long way in front of his body
a bit closer to off stump and Dickwella sweeps, out into the deep midwicket region
this is an excellent over, an excellent spell. Quicker delivery, close to off stump, and the pace pins Karunaratne on the crease while defending, and it spins sharply past his edge again
slower now, outside off, driven down to mid-off
full outside off, quicker, Karunaratne defends into the backward point region
tossed up outside off, driven into the covers
ooh, the reverse-sweep. Picks the right line for it, a flighted ball well outside off, and slaps it against the turn to the left of Amla diving from slip
down the track and he can't get to the pitch of the ball. Lovely flight and dip. Has to play a checked drive back to the bowler
quicker now, on off stump, goes back hurriedly and defends
flighted again, outside off, and out comes the sweep into the long-leg region
back of a length outside off, Karunaratne takes a big step back and across and clips to midwicket
shortish outside off, opens his bat face and steers it with the turn through point

Shamsi strikes again, his second wicket. It was coming, he had been threatening Dickwella's outside edge repeatedly over the last few overs. Gets it to dip on him again, and the lack of a front-foot stride hurts Dickwella, presses half-forward to defend this one just outside off, and the outside edge is easily pouched by Amla at slip

given! Big lbw appeal first ball, and it certainly struck Dilruwan in line, I think. Pressed forward to defend and the ball turned past the inside edge and hit front pad. Dilruwan has reviewed this. Pitched outside off, turned in sharply. Impact in line but ball-tracking says it would have missed leg stump. Reiffel will have to overturn his decision. Turned sharply, this, and Dilruwan got a big stride in.
shortish now, pitching on middle and leg and turning down leg. Skids on quicker than Dilruwan expects as he goes back to pull, and it hits him on the thigh pad
flighted ball on off and middle, clipped down to long-on
back of a length on the pads, tucked away to deep square leg

and he strikes first ball! Dilruwan presses forward to a delivery of excellent length in the fifth-stump channel, and pokes away from his body as the ball leaves him off the pitch. De Kock takes the edge one-handed, reacting late to it and just about sticking his glove out at the last moment. He ends up with a dazed look on his face
length ball slanting across the left-hander, pitching on off stump and angling further away, left alone
back of a length on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
fullish on off stump, good stride forward to defend to extra-cover
nice leave, fullish length and not too far from off stump, but he trusts the angle and flourishes his bat high over his head
lovely length again, drawing Herath forward and attacking the top of off stump. Defended solidly into the covers
nicely tossed up close to off stump, defended back towards the bowler
shortish, and the turn allows him some width, chopped to backward point
a touch short again, this time he waits a little longer and plays a little later to find the gap to the right of backward point
tossed up on off stump, gets a good stride forward to defend into the covers
floated up down leg, swept along the ground towards long leg. Dragged it off the inside half of the bat, I think
short, and Karunaratne pulls it from just outside off stump, to the left of midwicket
shortish on leg stump, and Herath swivels to whip it away to deep square leg. He loves this whippy pull
length ball slanting into the fifth-stump channel, straightens slightly but not enough to make Karunaratne play
back of a length, straightens slightly off the seam towards off stump. Karunaratne looks to defend from a half-forward position, and the ball rolls into the leg side off the inside edge
aborted appeal for lbw as Karunaratne plays down the wrong line looking for the straight drive. Thick inside edge into pad. May have straightened slightly off the seam

again he finds that little bit of movement. This one is slanting into the fourth-stump channel and Karunaratne looks to push it into the covers. Ends up sending it rolling through square leg off the inside edge
full on off stump, defended to mid-off
tossed up on off stump and Karunaratne spots an opportunity. Clears his front leg and hoicks it against the turn to the wide long-on boundary
a little quicker and fuller, drives towards mid-off and the bowler moves quickly to intercept

oh no, bad call from Karunaratne. Full on leg stump, and he clips to mid-on and calls Herath through for a risky single. Herath reacts a little late - to be fair to him, the single was never on - and the fielder, Philander, throws to the keeper's end. Herath is nowhere near the crease when de Kock whips off the bails
shortish, turning down leg. Can't connect with the flick off his hip
tossed up outside off, drives it hard, away from his body, but straight to mid-off

big appeal for lbw, and Paul Reiffel says no. Looked pretty close to me. A quickish delivery seeming to straighten from wicket to wicket, and Lakmal had no time to get any real stride in. South Africa have a review left but they don't use it. Pitching off, striking him in front of middle stump, hitting the inside of leg stump - poor decision from Reiffel, and South Africa should have reviewed it.
length ball on off stump, stays back and defends into the point region
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to the left of midwicket
stays back to a fullish ball on off stump and nonchalantly flicks it through square leg. Wow.
makes himself a lot of room to try and slap through the covers. Philander bowls a good-length ball on middle stump and all he manages is an inside-edge past leg stump
short, and the sharp turn gives Karunaratne width. Lets it come on and punches it to the right of sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, driven towards the fielder at extra-cover
tossed up and full, on the pads, clipped to the left of mid-on
lovely flight, floats it across to off stump and gets it to dip on Lakmal. Looks for the big cover drive and only manages an inside-edge that rolls away towards leg slip
presses forward to defend, and again there's some sharp turn. Flatter this time, beats the inside edge and hits the outside of his front pad
a rare bad ball, a full-toss outside off, and Lakmal lashes it away to the left of mid-off
full on off stump, shows the full face to drive to mid-on, who's deep enough to allow a single and move him to 99
back of a length close to off stump, keeps low and beats Lakmal's attemp to flick it across the line. Doesn't miss off stump by much
back of a length outside off, blocked into the covers
back of a length outside off, a bit of away seam movement. Jabs at it and it slices off the outside half of his bat, behind point
length ball, straightens slightly towards off stump. Karunaratne looks to open his bat face and glide it behind point, only manages an inside edge onto back pad
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket - he will stay on 99 for a little longer

that's missed everything. Tossed up, pitches just outside leg and turns further down leg. Plants his front leg forward to defend, and the ball beats his bat by a long way, his pad by a smaller distance, and sneaks between keeper and leg gully
low full-toss on off stump and he flicks it to midwicket and sets off hurriedly before being asked (rightfully) to turn back

there it is! A lovely way to bring up a magnificent hundred. Tossed up nice and full on middle stump, and he shows the full face to beat the stumps at the other end. The ball somehow goes all the way too, a rare sight on this deathly slow outfield
four more. Full on leg stump and he flicks it away easily through midwicket
short outside off, stabbed away to deep point to bring up Sri Lanka's 200
tossed up wide of off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
tossed up, ends up as a low full-toss just outside off stump, and Karunaratne reverse-sweeps flat and powerful, towards deep point
back of a length, turns into the pads, worked away through midwicket
poor line again, turns down the leg side, tucked away neatly to long leg
goes back to a length ball outside off, punches it back to the bowler
ooh, good ball, drifts in and doesn't turn as much as Lakmal expects. Plays back to a pretty full ball again, and only the inside-edge saves him from lbw as he jams his bat down in defence
tossed up slower outside off, and Lakmal strides forward to block it back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, stretches out and pushes into the covers
flighted ball on off stump and Lakmal goes after it, flat-bats it down the ground, to the right of the diving mid-off fielder
another appeal for lbw, not as confident this time. Missing leg stump, I think. A little quicker, and it beats Lakmal's inside edge and hits the outside of his front pad
again Lakmal ends up well outside the line as he comes forward to defend. This time the ball turns sharply down the leg side
short now, pulled away to deep square leg
floats this one outside leg stump and Karunaratne lap-sweeps it nice and fine to pick up two more
flat, back of a length, outside off. Not short enough to cut and it sneaks under Lakmal's bat
tossed up on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
stays back to a flighted ball on off stump and it turns sharply, beating his edge by a foot and hitting the outside of de Kock's right glove
back of a length, defended into the covers
draws him forward with flight outside off stump and beats his forward-defensive with dip and turn
full on off stump, clipped to mid-on
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
shortish, close to off stump, Karunaratne plays a front-foot pull to midwicket
length ball slanting away from off stump, presses forward and eases it to deep point with an open face
Back of a length outside off and Lakmal plays a flourishing, half-forward on-the-up drive into the cover point region
full on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
length ball angling into off stump, clipped towards mid-on
tossed up outside off, driven back towards the bowler
down the track now, gets close to the pitch of this flighted ball outside off and swipes it to deep midwicket
full on middle stump, defended towards midwicket
full again, outside off, driven firmly to short extra-cover
nice length, a bit of inward drift towards off stump and sharp turn away. Good, positive stride forward from Lakmal to defend that into the point region
tossed up closer to off stump, defended back to the bowler
short on off stump and Karunaratne pulls along the ground to the left of deep square leg

back of a length, angling into off stump. Hurries through and beats Lakmal for pace as he looks to defend with both feet in the air. Hits him on the back pad, and there's no appeal - probably going over. Runs away behind point for a leg bye
full, angling away from off stump, driven into the covers
off-stump yorker, stabbed towards point

short, and for once Karunaratne miscues a pull. This one actually leaves him a little, off the pitch, and he ends up having to drag it from outside off stump at shoulder height. Top-edges to the left of long leg, and Maharaj can't quite get to the catch in time
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
low full-toss, drifting into the pads, Lakmal flicks off the back foot and finds square leg

flatter and darted down the leg side, Lakmal falls over the leg-side flick, the ball defeats the keeper as well, and wanders away fine on the leg side for four. Given as byes although the keeper reckons it must have been off the thigh pad
tossed up slower and higher on off stump, Lakmal presses forward and defends competently
straighter one, turned defensively to short midwicket from the crease
full and slides on middle, another non-turner is played back to Maharaj
pushed through on off, very full, Lakmal bends forward to smother it
lifter on the leg stump, bursts off the deck on its way to the keeper. Dimuth is beaten on the hook
back of a length and slanting away outside off from over the stumps, Dimuth leans back, opens the face, punches out to deep point
bouncer aimed at the head of Lakmal, he ducks and evades it

Rabada has bounced out Lakmal. Umpire Reiffel raises his finger and sends the SL captain back. Banged in short, aimed at the ribs, Lakmal looks away, takes his eyes off the ball, and fends at it. It loops behind off the glove. Qdk snaffles it to give Rabada his fourth wicket
on a length on a fifth-sixth stump line outside off, Sandakan pokes at it and edges it wide of the cordon to third man. One would have done for SL. But Sandakan is now back on strike
bouncer, angled in on middle from over the stumps, 135ks, the batsman ducks under it and survives
fuller than a good length and angling away outside off, Dimuth steps away outside leg. He swishes and collects only thin air
looks like a slower offcutter, fuller, Dimuth does not read the change-up. He defends early as the ball rolls back to the bowler off an inside edge
back of a length and zipping away outside off, nearly takes the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat as Dimuth jabs away from the body
Dimuth opens the face as he meets this good-length ball on off stump and runs it away in the gap at backward point
shorter and hits the splice outside off, Sandakan hops and fends it off to the covers
overpitched on the leg stump, neatly flicked off the back foot through backward square leg
starts the over with a bouncer over middle and leg. Doesn't quite middle the pull and it rolls gently into the square leg region

shot! But it might just have gotten him out. Dean Elgar is unsure whether he's caught this cleanly coming in off the cover boundary, and they're going up to check. The soft signal is out. Rabada saw Karunaratne backing away from leg stump and banged it in short, following him. Still had just enough room to play an airborne horizontal-bat slap. Elgar runs in and takes it low, diving forward. Seems to catch it cleanly enough but has he lost control of it while he tumbles over? Replays are unclear, mostly, but the third umpire has flashed 'not out' on the screen.
another bouncer, homing inwards towards Sandakan's head. He somehow sways his chest away from the line while simultaneously ducking his head in the other direction, and gets under the ball
back of a length on off stump, whipped towards mid-on
bouncer outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling into off stump, hops off the ground and defends back towards the bowler
full, angling into off stump. Looks to drive into the covers and gets a thick inside edge that rolls towards midwicket
back of a length on off stump, gets on his toes to ride the bounce and defend
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away into the square leg region
bouncer over leg stump, Karunaratne thinks about hooking but decides in the end to duck, judges the height of it well
down the track, making room, and Steyn bowls one on off stump, fairly full, that he can slap away between extra-cover and mid-off
backs away again and Steyn follows him with a sharp bouncer. Sways his upper body away neatly, and ramps it to the fielder at third man
short again, over off stump, pulled to deep square leg. Rabada's overstepped here
short again, on off stump, pulled with ferocious power, but straight to the man on the square leg boundary. Refuses the single
sees him backing away and bowls another short ball, at his body, pulled to the right of deep square leg
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
again he backs away from leg stump, and again Rabada follows him with the bouncer. Ends up on his backside in the attempt to evade it
short on middle and off, pulled to deep square leg. Refuses the single again
backs away from leg stump once more, and this time he goes for the middle-stump yorker. Reaches out to stab it to deep point
back of a length on leg stump, sees Karunaratne looking to make room again. Tucked into the square leg region
shortish on middle stump, pulled a few meters to the left of long leg. Refuses the single again
back of a length on off stump, clipped to deep square leg. No single again
full on off stump, and Karunaratne shuffles across to whip it to the left of mid-on
full outside off, eases a drive to the right of mid-off, not sufficiently far enough from him to take a single
bouncer over off stump, Karunaratne's top-edged hook sails over the keeper and moves Sri Lanka four runs closer to 250
short, turning down leg, Sandakan ignores it
tossed up wide of off, presses forward and defends into the covers
shortish, turns in towards middle and leg, goes deep in his crease to work it to backward square leg
appeal for lbw as he stretches out to defend. Ball beat the inside edge but probably bounced too high. Struck him near the top of his back thigh
full on the pads, clipped to mid-on
dip and turn again as he stretches out to defend. Beats the inside edge comfortably and strikes him in line with middle and leg, but it's clearly spinning down leg. Barely an appeal
flight and dip outside off. Beats the inside edge as he comes forward to flick, and hits pad, but outside the line of off stump
tossed up outside off, comes forward and flicks towards midwicket
a little fuller and straighter, clipped away through backward square leg
short, wide, Sandakan can't connect with the cut
tossed up closer to off stump, defended into the cover point region
full on leg stump, defended to mid-on
tossed up outside off, defended into the point region. Sandakan had scampered out of his crease momentarily and the fielder conceded an overthrow at the bowler's end
tossed up outside off, driven to mid-off
dip and turn again to beat Sandakan's inside edge as he strode out to defend. Hits the front pad, but it's easily missing leg stump
full outside off, driven to the left of extra-cover, who makes a good diving stop
floated up wide of off, defended to point
tossed up outside off, nice stride forward to defend with the turn, into the on side
floaty full-toss, driven hard back to the bowler
on the pads, tickled away through backward square leg
nice flight outside off, dips and turns to beat the bat as Sandakan defends away from his body
closer to off stump and fuller, good stride forward to defend
full on middle stump, blocked into the covers
short and wide, extra bounce prevents Sandakan from connecting with the cut
short ball spins away sharply and Karunaratne ends up dragging an attempted cut to long-off
flights one wide outside off and Sandakan clobbers it, clears his front leg and launches it high over wide long-on
flatter now, defended with the turn into the on side
driven, and driven nicely. Saw some flight wide of off, and I think he picked the googly as well - this is what Sandakan bowls as well - and drove it with a flourish through cover point
shortish, turns down leg, Sandakan leaves it alone
fuller now, turning down leg again. Comes forward to defend and pretty much lets it hit his pad
on the pads, tucked away through square leg
tossed up outside off stump, defended to backward point
short outside off, slapped away through cover point
flighted ball outside off, draws Sandakan forward and beats his defence with dip and turn
full on off stump, blocked into the covers
<s>150, and a nice big hit to bring it up</s>. Tossed up just outside off and he slogs it away towards wide long-on, hitting against the turn
full outside off, and the attempted drive slices off the outside half of the bat, past the diving cover fielder
presses forward to defend, and the ball dips and turns and beats his inside edge. As has been the case with previous instances too, it's headed down the leg side
short now, rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
full outside off, driven to long-off. He brings up 150 now. Not sure why I thought he'd got there with the previous shot
slog-sweep. Wanted to hit that over midwicket, but the ball dipped shorter than he expected and turned, so he drags it along the ground through square leg
full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
full on middle and leg, blocked back down the pitch
full on off stump, driven towards mid-off, rolled off the bottom of the bat
tossed up a bit wider, and he drives to the left of mid-off. Looks like Maharaj has overstepped too, by a fair distance
beats the outside edge with one that drops onto a nice length outside off. He simply hasn't hit that length often enough today
as if to prove my point, he drops a little short and gets punched through cover point
tossed up slow and full on middle stump, defended into the covers
dangled up on off stump, makes himself extra room and lifts it over the covers. Bounces down to the left of the man sweeping up on the boundary
shot! Sees some generous flight wide of off stump and jumps down to lash a flat-bat drive to the right of mid-off. No stopping that even on this outfield
down the track again, a little too close to the pitch to go over the top, drags it along the ground to midwicket
flighted ball on middle and leg, gets on the front foot and looks to defend. Off the inside edge to backward square leg
down the track again, gets close to the pitch and chips this, on the bounce, to long-on
slides this down leg and Karunaratne gets down low to paddle it fine
tossed up slow on off stump, reverse-swept through backward point
not quite short enough to cut, too close to off stump. Chops it down into the ground off the bottom edge, rolls away through the slip region
long-hop outside off, Sandakan swivels and pummels it away to the midwicket boundary
short, wide, slapped to cover point
short, slow, down the leg side, and Sandakan is cross with himself for failing to connect with that swat
slow and short outside off. Sandakan thinks of cutting, and decides against it
full on off stump, makes a bit of room and lofts it to the left of sweeper cover
gone, is it? Nope. Stepped out too early and Shamsi fired it short and wide, spun away too wiude of off stump for de Kock to complete the stumping before Karunaratne got back to his crease
tossed up on middle and off, swept away through square leg
gone, finally. Down the track and Shamsi floats a googly wide of off stump. Reaches out but can't make contact, and he's stranded a long way down the wicket
turn and extra bounce first ball, from outside off. Elgar takes his bottom hand off and keeps it down
sharp turn down the leg side, misses the flick
flighted ball on middle stump, clipped to the left of midwicket
length ball on middle stump, defended into the on side
tossed up slower, outside off, stretches forward and blocks
quicker, flatter, back of a length outside off, left alone
floated up full on off stump, driven to mid-off
tossed up on a good length on middle stump, stretches out to block
full on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on
nice flight close to off stump, defended towards short extra
floated up full on leg stump, and Elgar plays slightly across it. Drifts in, doesn't turn, and beats the inside edge to hit pad. Easily missing leg stump, though
tossed up wider outside off, defended into the covers
flighted, drops onto a full length on off stump, big stretch forward to defend into the on side
tossed up outside off, driven firmly back to the bowler
flat length ball on off stump, stays on the back foot to defend into the on side

gone! Beautiful, beautiful bowling. Follows that quick stump-to-stump length ball with one dangled up slower, just outside off. Draws Markram forward but beats him for length, dipping shorter than he expects and turning away to grab the outside edge. Mathews falls to his right to take a lovely catch at slip
ooh, flatter now, round-arm, angling in towards off stump and turning less than Maharaj expected. Hits his pad as Maharaj ends up defending with bat behind pad, but impact was outside off
fired full outside off, left alone
floated up on middle and off, defended into the covers
full, angling down leg, clipped away towards the fine leg boundary
length ball pitching on middle and leg, turning down leg. Goes back, opens up and lets it hit his left pad
flat length ball turning in from outside off, goes deep in his crease to defend
nice flight outside off, Maharaj looks to drive against the turn and gets a thick inside edge that hits the ground and then pops up to leg slip
length ball that drifts across the stumps and doesn't straighten back in. Goes deep in his crease and manages to keep it out
back of a length outside off, pushed into the vacant cover region
tossed up slightly wide of off stump, Maharaj leaves it alone
plays back to one that spins from leg to off, and the ball goes past the outside edge of his defensive bat and hits the back pad - too high for Herath to bother with an appeal
a touch short, punched into the cover point region
tossed up slow, dips and spins from off to leg. Presses forward, lets it come, and tucks it to backward square leg
full outside off, eased gently to the left of backward point
tossed up outside off, gets forward and plays a checked drive to short cover
a touch slower, and drops slightly shorter. Stretches forward and defends into the off side
flatter, angling into middle and leg, defended back down the pitch
flighted ball wider outside off, driven to cover point
back of a length outside off, punched to cover point

slower now, full and dropping down on a middle-stump line. Elgar's bat comes down from gully towards mid-on - as is usually the case - as he tries to defend, and the ball squirts off the leading edge into the point region
arm ball darting in towards off stump, goes back and slaps to backward point
goes back to a length ball close to off stump, defends into the off side

tossed up now, and Herath has his man. Dips on Maharaj, and he's suddenly nowhere near the pitch of this ball as he stretches out to defend. Goes on with the arm, beats the inside edge, and pings the front pad right in front of middle and off. Maharaj doesnt bother with a review, and rightly so - ball-tracking says it would have hit a good chunk of leg stump
ooh, that's a beauty to start. Comes in with the arm and Amla is playing back when he should have been forward. Manages to jab it away into the off side
slower, flightier, drifts in slightly towards off stump. Defends slightly outside the line and the ball hits the inside half of his bat
floated up wider, driven through cover point
dangled up enticingly, wide of off stump. Elgar ignores the bait, and wisely - turned quite sharply
full on middle and off, blocked towards mid-on
down the track now and Dilruwan floats it slow and wide of off. Big stretch out to get close to the pitch and defend
quicker now, angling into off and middle, Elgar defends into the off side
sees some flight outside off and jumps out. Clips it to Lakmal at mid-on. He fumbles, and a risky single becomes a safe one
nice length, a tiny bit of drift away and it turns back towards off stump. Amla stays back again, even though the length is pretty full, and defends with the turn
slowly flighted outside off and Elgar tries the reverse-sweep. Dip and bounce defeat the shot, and the ball hits him in the midriff
goes for the reverse again and this time the length is fuller and he's able to middle it. Mathews anticipaes, moves quickly to his left from slip and slows down the ball with a diving stop
length ball close to off stump, defended down the pitch
slower now, drifting in towards off stump, not much turn, gets forward and defends with soft hands
back of a length, pitches on off stump and climbs steeply with a bit of turn. Hits high, near the shoulder of the bat, as he goes back to defend, but safely downwards into the point region
stays back again to a length ball close to off stump, defends into the off side. He's trusting the slowness of this pitch
a touch short and he rocks back to cut, but there's a deepish cover point to stop it

gone! Elgar's technique - bat coming down from gully to mid-on - has cost him here. Fairly full, angling in towards middle stump. Opens up and plays across it, looking to play towards mid-on, and the ball spins, takes the outside edge, and settles in the hands of first slip
full on off and middle, clipped to the right of mid-on and he calls nice and early for the quick single. A bit of a fumble, but the single was on anyway
length ball turning into off stump, defended with soft hands into the on side
lovely flight and dip wide of off. Stretches forward and across to defend and doesn't get anywhere near the pitch of it. Turns in and catches the inside edge, rolls away through midwicket
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
goes back to a length ball spinning away from off stump, defends with soft hands and the outside edge rolls gently into the point regio
a bit slower and he draws Bavuma half-forward to defend with the turn into the off side

lovely. Tosses this up and gets it to drift in towards off stump. Bavuma goes for the inside-out drive and ends up hitting it back to the bowler, with the drift making him hit it with the insdie of his bat face
fullish outside off, defended into the covers
dangled up wide of off stump, driven to cover point. Bavuma's eagerness to drive will make Herath quite happy, I think
ooh. Length ball turning in towards middle stump. Amla flicks it across his front pad, and the ball flashes past Dhananjaya at leg gully, just to his left
tossed up outside off, defended into the covers
skips out of his crease now, clips it from outside off to mid-on, and has to be sent back by Amla after starting to charge down looking for the single
beauty. Drifts away slightly and keeps going away from the batsman after pitching. Goes back to defend and it beats his outside edge comfortably
tossed up higher and closer to off stump, stretches out to defend
tossed up wide of off, looks to sweep and is defeated by lack of turn. Hits him in the midriff
length ball outside off, defended into the covers
a bit of drift in towards off stump, fairly full, defended into the off side
floated up wider, driven firmly into the covers
tossed up slow on off stump and Bavuma gets a positive stride forward and sweeps. Decisive footwork there, and he beats backward square leg easily to his left
tossed up wider still, looks for the drive through cover point but goes a little early at it and drags it to extra-cover
flighted ball on middle stump and this is risky - sweeping right off the stumps - but he middles it again and gets four, into that same gap to the left of backward square leg
down the track now to the flighted ball outside off, and gets close to the pitch and lofts this nicely over the non-strikers head
continues to flight it, a little closer to off stump, and he presses forward to defend into the on side
there's that straighter one again, floating away with some drift, and he goes back and defends in front of off stump
down the track again, and this time the line's slightly wider and he lofts it over mid-off
flight and dip and turn from outside off, and Amla, stretching out to defend, is beaten on the inside edge, but he's got his pad outside the line
a touch fuller outside off, defended into the cover point region
gets his feet all in a tangle. Goes back to a full one outside off, turns quite sharply as he defends, and the edge drops down to the right of slip
the sweep again, from just outside off. Controls it nicely and gets a single to the left of backward square leg
floated up outside off, defended with an open face into the point region
flighted ball on middle and leg, defended into the on side
again that middle-stump line, a bit of drift in too. Quite full, and he clips it to mid-on

length ball on off stump, Amla eases it with an open face to the right of backward point. After those two middle-and-leg balls, he didn't really get his front foot across to this one, and played slightly away from his body. It's this kind of subtle thing that Herath excels in doing
length ball outside off, gets forward and defends with soft hands, with the turn
looks to step out but this time there isn't so much flight and he doesn't have the time to get to the pitch. Jabbed back to the bowler
length ball turning in towards off stump, uses his wrists to clip it to midwicket
tossed up slightly wider, defended back towards the bowler
flatter, angling into middle stump and turning in further. Clipped to short leg off the back foot
tossed up slower on middle and off. Comes forward and defends to short leg
not this one. Goes back to a length ball straightening towards off stump, blocks to short cover
slightly slower, turns away slightly from off stump. Only half-forward, manages to defend it into the covers
ha, brilliant bowling. Tossed it up much wider, with a lot more overspin than usual, and beats his flashy drive with turn and bounce
fuller now, on middle stump, clipped to mid-on
tossed up wide of off stump, driven to point
flatter, round-arm, angling into off stump. A touch short and Bavuma is able to go back and work this to the right of midwicket
tossed up outside off, pretty full, defended back to the bowler
steps out a touch too early and Dilruwan bowls a flat one turning into the pads. Flicked to backward square leg
flatter again, turns in sharply from outside off. Beats Amla's back-foot flick by a long way and hits pad, but it's easily missing leg stump
slower now, lots of turn again, and Amla's front-foot flick is beaten this time. Hits pad again, though once more it's sliding down leg
goes for the sweep and misses, and that's a big lbw appeal. Not given, not reviewed. Did that hit him in line with off stump or just outside?

big appeal for a catch at short leg, and Paul Reiffel is unmoved. Sri Lanka have reviewed this... Was looking to step out, I think, and Dilruwan fired it in flatter on middle stump. Only manages a half-step forward as this spins in sharply, and aims a hurried flick at it. Ultra Edge shows a spike as it passes his glove. Hits pad and pops up for short leg to gobble up. Amla will have to walk back now.

Is this two in two? Big appeal for a catch at slip, not given by Rod Tucker, and Sri Lanka have reviewed again. Stretches out to defend one that spins less that expected, from outside off, and the ball goes past inside edge - replays confirm this - and pops off the pad to Mathews at slip. Ball tracking says it would have hit the stumps but impact was outside off. Faf survives

big appeal again as this one comes in with the angle and beats his back-foot defensive. Was sliding down leg. Or was it? Maybe Sri Lanka should have reviewed this one, because ball-tracking says it would have hit leg stump
full outside off, left alone
there's the sweep again, just to the left of backward square leg
length ball on off stump, defended into the on side
length ball outside off, defended into the covers
floats it across to off stump, stretches out to defend into the covers
goes back to a quickish length ball on off and middle, jabs it away to the left of short leg
shortish outside off, cuts it to backward point
fuller now, outside off, defended gently into the vacant cover region - that's the danger of bowling with six on the leg side, but he's getting enough turn to allow it
down the track to this middle-stump ball, clips it in the air, just out of reach of short midwicket diving to his left
tossed up, spinning in towards off stump. Good decisive stride forward from Faf to sweep this hard and square
turns this down the leg side, Bavuma aborts his flick
bowled him, the sweep has cost Bavuma in the end. Tossed up fairly wide of off, perhaps too full to sweep. Ends up dragging it into his stumps off the bottom edge
short, wide, the first bad ball of the morning, chopped away to the left of backward point
full on off stump, eased away to sweeper cover - the fielder dropped back there after that previous short ball
tossed up on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
turns down the leg side now, du Plessis lets it go past to the keeper, who fumbles it
ooh, drifts in and continues with the angle towards off stump. Stays back, and he's a little late on his defensive jab into the on side
tossed up outside off, gets forward to block it back to the bowler
yikes, plays away from his body in defence, looking for turn away from outside off. Doesn't turn, and the inside edge rolls into the leg side
fuller, defended back to the bowler

down the track now, and is that caught at slip? Nope, just a lot of turn and bounce. Flighted outside off, QdK doesn't reach the pitch of it, tries to play against the turn and whip it from outside off. Misses, the ball jumps over his edge and into Mathews' hands at slip

oh man, QdK has looked on edge right through, and now he's bowled, the ball spinning past the outside edge of his front-foot defensive and crashing into his off stump. Drifts into middle and off, and turns to hit off stump. QdK plays slightly across it, looking to defend that towards mid-on, and opens up in the process. They check Dilruwan's foot to see if he overstepped, and oh man, it's close - to me, it looked like his foot landed right on top of the white line, with no part of his heel behind, but the third umpire has deemed it a legal delivery
full on off stump, defended off the front foot
tossed up slow and full on off and middle, driven to mid-off
tossed up a little wider outside off, still too full to trouble Faf. Doesn't have to get too far forward to smother it
length ball turning in towards off stump, goes back and jabs into the covers. Was slightly cramped for room there
back of a length, only marginal turn after slanting across to off stump, defended off the back foot
a touch short again, slapped hard, into the ground, to the right of Herath in the covers
excellent length outside off, and Faf, coming forward to try and clip it to midwicket or mid-on, plays for more turn than there is. Outside edge rolls away to the right of slip
tossed up outside off, stretches out and defends into the on side
a bit fuller, defended with soft hands and the ball rolls towards short leg
goes back to a length ball turning towards leg stump, tucks it away to the left of leg gully
dangles up a wide, flighted delivery first up - go ahead, hit me through that big gap, he says - but he only manages to drag that drive back to the bowler, off the inside half of the bat

jumps up from just back of a length, outside off, and Philander, going back and across to defend, and gets a thick inside edge that balloons up off thigh pad. Doesn't carry to short leg, though, as he dives forward and to his left
full on leg stump, clipped away to the left of leg gully
floated across the right-hander, wide of off. Gets forward and across and eases it into the backward point region with an open face
flighted and full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
goes back to a length ball turning into middle stump, clips it hurriedly to leg gully. Was playing around his front pad there
the wrong'un. Floated across, pitches outside off and spins further away, left alone. Dickwella needlessly rips the stumps out of the ground. No danger of Philander dragging his back foot out there
quickish length ball pitching on off stump and straightening in. Defended into the on side
back of a length outside off, shuffles back and across to defend, and the ball spins past his inside edge and hits back pad. Impact outside the line, though
now he beats the inside edge of his forward defensive, but again he's got that front pad outside the line
ripping turn once more, Faf just leaves it after coming forward to try and work it leg-side. Pitched on middle stump and Dickwella took it a long way down the leg side
back of a length, not as much turn this time, towards off stump. Goes deep in his crease and uses his wrists to play it down in front of short leg
quickish length ball turning in towards off stump. Gets forward and defends with soft hands
full on off stump, clipped to straight midwicket
wrong'un, pitches a long way down the leg side, though, and Philander needlessly aims a flick at it. He's lucky he misses. Off the pad to leg gully
the stock ball now, turns down leg again
tossed up outside off, driven to mid-off
floated up wide of off stump and Philander goes for the big slog. Drags it past his leg stump off the inside edge
full on off stump, driven firmly to short extra-cover
flatter and shorter, outside off, slapped to backward point
flat length ball speared across to off stump, defended back down the pitch
on the pads now, clipped to the right of midwicket
beautifully flighted, dips on off stump as Philander stretches out to defend. Spins sharply past the inside edge, onto pad. Too sharply to elicit an lbw appeal
fuller, clipped into the square leg region
flat, back of a length, not much turn. Goes back and flicks it from middle stump through square leg
back of a length again, spinning in towards off and middle. Goes back and across and works this to backward square leg
wrong'un, pitching outside leg. Faf lets it come on and defends with soft hands towards leg gully
more flight now, floated across to a wide line outside off, driven to mid-off
down the track now and Sandakan bowls it flat at his feet. Stabbed back to the bowler
tossed up, drops onto a fullish length outside off, defended into the off side
overpitched, offers some width too, Faf drives straight to the man at cover
once again it's overpitched and wide, and this time Faf flat-bats his drive to the left of the cover fielder and picks up a rare boundary
drifting into the right-hander from around the wicket, the batsman takes a small stride forward and defends
a small press forward and a straight bat to block
opens the face slightly to slice the drive into the covers, Herath is keeping it wicket to wicket
defended into the off side
slower through the air on off and middle, Philander is on the front foot a fraction too early and then he waits and defends
nudged into the leg side for a single
tossed up outside off, driven off the front foot towards point
Philander presses forward and closes the face to push into the leg side
defended watchfully on the front foot into the off side

that's the one that turns back into the right-hander and the bounce nearly does Philander in, he came forward and pushed at the ball with a gap between bat and pad, and the ball went right through it, thankfully for South Africa it missed the stumps
played into the ground and back to the bowler, who jumps to catch it
once again a single off the final ball, off a push into the off side on the front foot
darted into middle stump from over the wicket, defended on the front foot with bat close to front pad

an appeal, for lbw presumably, was it pad first? There definitely was bat on it as Philander pressed forward to defend. No review taken. It was pad first! Replays show it would have hit middle of middle. Philander escapes
loops into the right-hander from over the wicket, the ball pitching out of reach of the front foot defence and the ball spinning away to beat the outside edge
fuller and straighter, driven back to the bowler
played back to the bowler once again
Du Plessis will have the strike after Philander blocks the last ball into the covers
width outside off stump, and the length is short enough to let Faf stay back and punch towards point
tossed up angling into off stump, Philander drives from the crease towards the bowler
slapped off the back foot into the covers, the throw needed to be at the bowler's end, that was a risky run! Faf though is too quick at the striker's end
driven off the front foot into the covers where the fielder dives to cut off the shot
gets down on one knee, the front pad outside off, and sweeps behind square
drives hard but mis-times the shot, mid-off is deep though and there's a single available
defended on the front foot on the off side
fuller length on middle and leg, plays the on-drive to mid-on
a bit too full to cut off the back foot and the bottom edge bounces into the ground and to first slip

another huge appeal for lbw, much more confident this time, and up goes the finger! Philander reviews. The question again is whether it is pad or bat first as he tried to cut off the back foot. It was definitely pad first. But now the impact? Looks outside off? It is outside off. Paul Reiffel will have to overturn his decision. The ball was missing off as well.
pitches on middle, short of a length and spins towards off, Philander stays back and works the ball on the leg side
steps a long way out of his crease and then has to offer defence as he's beaten in the flight, the ball thuds off his front pad
cut off the back foot towards point, who is a bit deep
defended on the front foot with bat close to front pad
pins into the right-hander, defended from the crease with bat in front off pad and the ball squirts towards short leg off the inside edge
presses forward and blocks
flatter and straighter, Philander goes back and defends towards short leg
nice flight outside off and turn back into the right hander, Philander waits and defends
spins away from Faf, who moves forward and defends
gives him the charge but then mis-times the shot along the ground to mid-on
bowled on an immaculate line on middle and off, defended on the front foot
driven hard off the front foot but the fielder at mid-off dives to his left and cuts off the boundary
drives through cover and this time out of the reach of the diving fielder in the in-field and the ball gets to the boundary
tries to defend on the front foot but the ball takes the inside edge and rolls past slip
a length ball pitching outside off and angling in, defended on the back foot into the off side
good length outside off at a gentle pace, the batsman shoulders arms, they haven't had that luxury in a while!
a touch fuller and angling in, keeps a bit low as well, Philander stays in his crease and defends, unconvincingly
punched off the back foot through the covers, nicely timed too but this outfield is a bit slow
a stride forward and a push into the covers, quick single, this time the throw is at Philander's end and he gets into a tangle as the ball hits his pads, he was home safely though
