five wickets and 82 runs in the session, as Faf punches the final ball before lunch through covers
tossed up on off stump, driven to mid-off
length ball outside off, presses forward, lets it come on, and dabs it gently wide of slip with an open face
floated up on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
full, flighted ball on middle and off, defended back down the pitch
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped gently to short leg
ooh, this keeps a little low. Length ball, straightening from middle stump, and Faf defends off the back foot. Had to jam his bat down hurriedly to keep that out
angles this one in to middle and leg, defended from the crease, into the on side
stays back to a length ball drifting in and straightening towards middle and leg, clips it to the right of midwicket
tossed up, drifting into leg stump, defended into the on side
tossed up, drops slightly shorter than the previous one and slides on with the angle. Faf defends, and the ball slides off the inside half of the bat past short leg
length ball on off and middle, slightly quicker, defended into the point region
tossed up full on off stump, lets it come on and steers it to the left of backward point
tossed up just outside leg. Faf comes forward to flick it with the turn and gets an inside edge that falls just short of the leg gully fielder diving to his right
fuller, clipped into the midwicket region
flighted ball outside off, Philander defends, playing for more turn than there is, and is beaten on the outside
quicker, straighter, stays back and blocks to short leg
length ball spinning in towards off stump, a bit of extra bounce. Hits high on the bat, near the sticker, as Philander defends
tossed up slightly wider outside off and fuller, blocked into the covers
length ball drifting in to off and middle and straightening. Faf defends off the front foot
tossed up higher, pitches quite full on middle and off, defended into the covers
flatter, more round-arm, pitches outside off and turns away. Faf defends for the angle, and the outside edge squirts away past slip
a touch shorter on off stump, punched to cover point
tossed up slow on middle stump, stretches out and blocks

ooh, skids on with the angle, and Faf is caught on the crease a little. Round-arm, slides on towards middle and off, and Faf is only half forward in defence. Inside edge goes past short leg, on the bounce
length ball on middle stump, defended off the back foot
ooh, goes for the sweep and misses, and the ball narrowly misses off stump. Tossed up and it dips shorter than Faf expects, on an off stump line, but doesn't quite straighten enough to hit the stumps
fuller now, driven back to the bowler
flighted ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
goes back to a length ball straightening towards off stump, deep in his crease, and defends solidly
down the track now, gets closer to the pitch of the ball than he'd like. Wanted to drive this through extra-cover, I think, but ended up hitting it to mid-off
flighted ball drifting in towards off stump, defended into the covers
straighter line, defended back to the bowler
length ball spinning towards off stump, goes back and defends with the turn
fuller, on leg stump, stretches out and defends down the pitch
length ball pitching outside leg, defends towards short leg
ooh, beauty. Slants this across to middle stump, and gets it to dip on Philander as he strides forward to defend. Sharp turn to beat the outside edge
tossed up, angling across from round the wicket and pitching on off stump, stretches out to defend
a bit quicker though not necessarily shorter, goes back to defend in front of off stump. Hits the outside half of the bat and rolls wide of slip
tossed up outside off and Faf picks the line well, gets a big stride out to sweep it hard and square
ooh, turn and bounce. Flighted slow on middle stump, dips and strikes Faf high on the thigh pad as he finds his stride inadequate
fuller, clipped to short leg
stays back to a fairly full ball on middle stump, jams his bat down hurriedly to defend
tossed up outside leg, pads it away, with bat next to pad
another length ball pitching outside leg, this time he goes back and lets it hit his pad, with no shot offered
tossed up, dangled across to off stump and spinning further away, left alone
flat and much quicker, lands on a good length outside off, Philander leaves it alone
this one's way down the leg side and doesn't spin either, Philander offers his thigh pad, should it happen to turn
tossed up on leg stump, defended into the off side, with his pad well out of the way
sharp turn and bounce from off stump as Faf comes forward to defend. Hits high up on the pad as he hurriedly pulls his gloves out of the way
goes on the back foot now, to a length ball on middle. Defended into the on side
too full, on off stump, driven back firmly and it beats mid-off to his right
tossed up on leg stump. Faf defends and the turn finds his inside edge. Played it with soft hands, though, and it rolls away to the right of short leg
tossed up outside off, driven into the covers
length ball spinning towards leg stump, clipped away between short leg and leg gully, off the front foot
round-arm, angling into middle and off, defended from the crease
there's the flighted ball with more overspin. Tossed up just outside off and Philander reaches out at it as it rips past his outside edge
fuller, blocked back to the bowler
ooh, flatter and angled in with a wider arm. Philander leaves it - it doesn't turn, and doesn't miss off stump by all that much
angles this into leg stump now, opens up to defend into the on side
full, flighted ball on off stump, defended into the covers
on leg stump, defended to short leg
sticks to that leg-stump line, defended into the leg side
flatter now, goes back to work it to deep backward square leg
back of a length, slanting across and straightening slightly towards off stump, goes back and clips towards midwicket

ooh, edged, and did it carry to slip? That angle from round the wicket creates this chance. Tossed up, gets some drift across towards off stump. Doesn't turn as much as Philander expects, and he plays it with bat well away from pad. Don't think the edge carried to Mathews, though
and again. Drifts it across and doesn't turn it back in. This time it beats Philander's forward defence
short, a bit of width, du Plessis slaps it away to the point boundary
length ball angling into the fourth-stump channel. Presses forward and defends towards point
length ball angling into off stump. Du Plessis defends with an open face, looking to dab that towards gully, and only ends up chopping it into the ground
fuller now, fifth-stump line, and du Plessis goes hard at it with an angled bat, looking to drive through the covers, and gets a thick edge that flies into the gap between slip and gully

back of a length on off stump, and again Faf defends slightly outside the line, with a chopping motion - is Lakmal getting a bit of reverse into the right-hander? The ball hits inside edge and runs away through square leg
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region. Thjs one seemed to move in the other direction
tossed up quite full on off stump, clipped towards midwicket, who dives to his right to stop the ball
floated across, a little wider, defended into the vacant cover region
length ball on off stump, good stride forward to defend

given! Goes back and across to a length ball and he's beaten for pace as he looks to jam his bat down on it and try to defend into the on side. Spins past his inside edge and hits his front pad. Reiffel raises his finger, Philander reviews after consulting with Faf. Pitches on off stump, hitting off stump, according to ball-tracking
tossed up on off stump, gets forward to defend
flighted ball, drops onto a good length outside off, defended with the turn into the covers

bowled him! Lakmal threatened this mode of dismissal even in his previous over, and now manages it. Beautiful delivery, pitches on the perfect length outside off to catch du Plessis half-forward in defence, and nips in to hit the top of off, after going between bat and pad. Du Plessis had been inside-edging a few, playing slightly outside the line, and now he misses one altogether
length ball angling into off stump and straightening slightly. Steyn defends from the crease, and sends an outside edge racing away between second slip and gully
back of a length, angling into off stump from wide of the crease, defended towards mid-on
length ball outside off, Steyn drives away from his body and sends an inside edge rolling into the on side
low full-toss on off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and closes his face slightly to pick up a single to the right of mid-on
tossed up slow, floating across to off stump, and Steyn stretches out to defend square on the off side, with an open bat face
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
goes back and across to this short-of-a-length delivery and it turns sharply, down the leg side
tossed up fuller, defended back down the pitch
goes back to a length ball turning into off stump, defends into the on side. Kept slightly low there
and this one jumps at Steyn from outside off. Goes back and across to defend and it hits him on the thigh pad
length ball angling from right-arm over to middle stump, clipped into the midwicket region
Shortish, angling into off stump, gets on his toes and defends with high right elbow
fuller now, driven to mid-off
big lbw shout, but that's surely missing leg stump. Rabada's feet hardly moved from his leg-stump guard as he angled this in from wide of the crease, back of a length. Looked to flick and missed
length ball angling into off stump, defended back to the bowler
bouncer, angling in and rising over off stump, Rabada ducks awkwardly under it. Clearly a big effort ball from Lakmal, he's overstepped by six inches

bowled him. Left-hander, right-hander, doesn't matter who he's bowling to, he'll hit the top of off stump. Angles this in from wide of the crease, and Rabada feet stay stuck to the crease in defence, his bat comes down at an angle, not close enough to his body to account for the angle, and it's past the inside edge and bye bye. They check Lakmal's front foot, and his heel may have been juuuuuuuust behind the back of the crease when it landed. Benefit of doubt, I think
length ball pitching on middle and straightening slightly. Goes on the back foot to defend
tossed up slower, doesn't turn too much from an off-stump line. Steyn presses forward and defends with an open face, looking for turn, and the ball runs away to the right of slip off the outside edge
goes back and across to a length ball spinning from middle to leg, clips it into the square-leg region
stays back to a length ball slanted across to off stump, is hurried into his defensive jab
once again, goes back to a length ball. This time it's on middle stump and he defends towards short leg
yet again, a flat length ball on middle stump, and he goes on the back foot to defend into the on side
length ball on off stump, punched into the covers
ooh. This one's just back of a length, and it angles in and straightens juuuuust outside off stump. Steyn jabs at it with no footwork, and the ball beats his outside edge
and that is it. Length ball close to off stump, straightens slightly. Steyn clears his front leg and goes for a big hoick, and only manages to send a thick edge to first slip
and he starts with a short one outside off. Gunathilaka stands tall and slaps it away through point
a better length this time, slanting across to off stump and straightening slightly, looks to defend and it hits the inside half of his bat
back of a length outside off, punched into the point region
length ball slanting away from off stump, climbs steeply after Gunathilaka leaves and de Kock collects high over his head
length ball on off stump, punched down the ground, to the left of mid-off
full, close to off stump. Drives with a straight bat and it stops on him slightly. Plays a fair way in front of his body and the ball loops in the air, but into the gap to the left of mid-off
length ball on off stump, clipped towards midwicket

and again, the ball stops on Gunathilaka. Length ball, slanting across to off stump. Checks his drive, and the ball pops up high in the air, looping back over the leaping bowler and dropping to the ground behind the umpire
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
back of a length on leg stump, a bit of extra bounce. Shapes to flick and ends up letting it hit his thigh pad, pulling his bat out of the way
length ball on middle stump, blocked towards mid-on
back of a length, slanting across to off stump, defended into the extra-cover region
back of a length, angling across to off stump. Lets it come on and uses his wrists to clip it wide of mid-on
shortish, close to off stump, rides the bounce and dabs it down into the point region
ooh. Back of a length, angling across to off stump, and it keeps low. Was on his toes early, and then had to jam down on it to keep it out
fullish, on the pads, clipped away through the vacant midwicket region
back of a length, slanting away from off stump. Karunaratne jabs at it with no footwork and the outside edge runs away between second slip and gully
fullish, close to off stump, gets a nice stride in to defend into the covers
length ball on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
back of a length on middle and off, defended back towards the bowler
there's that offcutter, nipping away from a good length close to off stump. Defended into the point region
length ball close to off stump, blocked into the covers
length ball on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, stabbed away to point
bouncer, climbing high over leg stump, Karunaratne crouches low to evade it
back of a length outside off, Karunaratne punches it away into the cover point region
back of a length on off stump, gets on top of the bounce to defend into the on side
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
tossed up outside off, nice stride forward to get close to the pitch of the ball and defend
down the track, meets this flighted ball on the full and clips it from outside off towards mid-on

sharp turn now, as he goes back and across to one that turns and jumps from the footmarks outside off stump. Lbw appeal, not given, and South Africa have reviewed. Beat the inside edge clearly as he defended on the shuffle. What does ball-tracking say? It's hitting middle stump, but the shuffle had taken Gunathilaka just far enough across to get an umpire's call on impact
goes back to a length ball outside off and defends into the off side
fuller now, clipped away through midwicket
tossed up outside off, lands too full to really trouble the batsman. Presses forward and smothers any spin
nice length on off stump, spins away. Gunathilaka is half-forward to defend into the cover point region
full on off and middle, driven firmly back towards the bowler, who gets a hand to it and sends it rolling to mid-off
full again, on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
full on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
tossed up, leg-stumpish, clipped to the left of midwicket
back of a length outside off, Gunathilaka leaves it alone, pulling his bat inside the line
back of a length, turns in towards off stump, goes back and across and works it through square leg

dropped! Oh dear. Bavuma, running to his left from backward square leg and putting in a dive, and he gets both hands to it a foot or so off the ground. It was tossed up outside off, and Gunathilaka went across for the lap-sweep
plays with the turn, clips it away through midwicket
full outside off, defended back towards the bowler
back of a length, turning in towards middle and off, defended off the back foot
a little wider, lets it come on and dabs to backward point
slant a length ball back in from around the stumps, defended carefully
right back into the crease as he steers this length delivery to point
touch short, not much width though, eased to point again
gets half a stride in forward to defend this full length delivery
too full, he leans into the drive, gets it past the cover fielder. Half-stop there but that only managed to take the pace off.
tails in a yorker, Karunaratne somehow manages to squeeze that back
steps out and then has to lunge forward a long way to defend, the ball dips and spins back in to beat the inside edge.
goes back and across to defend this flat delivery on the stumps
leans forward and eases this tossed up delivery to cover
gets outside the line of the stumps and smothers this
works this off a length on middle and leg to the legside
slides one on off, Karunaratne goes back and across to bunt that away. It's tea on day two.
fullish, with a bit of width, eased away between cover and short extra-cover, prioritising control over power
back of a length on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length abd wude, and he leans back, waits, and chops it away to the left of gully
appeal for lbw, but it pitched outside leg and hit him on the thigh pad, as he looked to tuck it away into the leg side
fuller now, on middle stump, a tiny bit of shape into the left-hander, clipped away through square leg
length ball on the pads, clipped to long leg. An erratic first over after tea from Steyn
back of a length, turns in towards middle and leg, goes back and works it to backward square leg
back of a length outside off, defended to extra-cover
goes back and across to a length ball spinning in from outside off, tucks it to backward square leg
tossed up fuller outside off, stretches out to sweep and misses. Hits his pad well outside the line of off stump
back and across to a flatter length ball spinning in towards off stump, clips it to midwicket
down the track now to a flighted ball outside off, blocks it back to the bowler
short on leg stump, gets up to waist height, pulled round to long leg
ooh, good ball. Length ball slanting away into a fifth-stump line, inviting the drive away from the body. Gunathilaka goes for it and misses
back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the hip to deep square leg
full outside off, driven to cover point
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to steer it down to third man
length ball outside off, defended to short extra
tossed up outside off, stretches out to defend into the covers
goes back and across to a length ball outside off, defends from deep in his crease
jumps out at the flighted ball outside off. Gets it to dip and forces him to stretch out and defend with the turn, to short leg
tossed up outside off, swept away to the right of the diving short fine leg fielder and to the left of deep square leg
another flighted ball, even wider outside off, sweeps it closer to deep square leg this time
chips down the track again, gets to the pitch of this tossed-up delivery outside off and punches it back to the bowler
bouncer, angling across the left-hander. Ducks low to evade it
full now, slanting into a sixth-stump line, left alone
another bouncer, at  a pretty sharp pace (135kph, 87mph) over middle stump. Gunathilaka ducks again
short again, this time shoulder-high outside off. Lets it come on and uses the pace to dab it down to third man
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, eased down to third man
length ball angling well wide of the left-hander. Left alone
sharp turn and bounce from outside off as he shapes to defend off the back foot. Gets a thick inside edge into thigh pad
down the track now, clips it away with the turn to long-on

goes for the reverse-sweep now, a difficult shot out of the footmarks outside off stump. Glove, forearm, and then loops in the air, but frustratingly wide, for South Africa, of both their keeper and first slip, both haring towards a silly point position
goes wider outside off now and Gunathilaka leaves
tossed up slow, wide of off stump, stretches out to defend
dangled up outside off, once more, and this time Gunathilaka sweeps hard and along the ground to deep square leg
full, slanting away from off stump, and it's past the outside edge as Gunathilaka reaches out to defend
fullish on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, stretches out and eases it to point with an open face. Rabada dives right and half-stops it, allowing a single
full outside off and Karunaratne drives it firmly down the ground, in the gap to the left of mid-off
length ball on off stump, defended to short extra
back of a length outside off, punched towards point, where Rabada falls to his left and only manages to deflect it away into the cover region
down the track and the bowler flattens his trajectory. Blocked back to Maharaj
full outside off, clipped with the turn to midwicket
full outside off, and Karunaratne misses the reverse-sweep. Stretched out too far across and the ball missed his bat, sneaked under his thigh, and missed off stump too
tossed up wider, stretches out to push into the point region
finally, a wicket. Down the track to the flighted ball outside off and he goes for the big hit with the turn. Only succeeds in picking out deep midwicket running to his left
length ball turning in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and clips to midwicket
back of a length, angling slightly down leg. Shuffles across and misses the flick
fullish on middle stump, clipped away to the right of square leg
length ball on middle and leg, clipped away through backward squrae leg
ooh, so close! Slants across the left-hander, pitching back of a length, and keeps low as he looks to defend. Beats the inside edge, and narrowly misses off stump
tossed up close to off stump, stretches out to defend
down the track to the middle-stump delivery, drives it down towards long-on
shot! The arm ball, sliding in towards off stump, but he leans back, making a bit of room, and waits until the last moment to late-cut past slip
quicker length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
tossed up on leg stump, defended into the on side
wham. Down the track to the flighted ball outside off, and he thwacks it over the long-on boundary, unmindful of the fact that he's hitting against the turn
length ball on middle and off, defended back down the pitch
back of a length on off stump, stops on the batsman slightly. Uses his wrists to play that to mid-on
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, defended to midwicket
length ball on off stump, punches it neatly into the gap between short extra-cover and mid-off, the latter fielder diving to his right to make the save
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
down the track, gets close to the pitch of this off-stump ball and clips it to deep midwicket

bowled him! Maharaj hits the perfect length, and pitches middle-and-leg, goes past the outside edge, and hits off. Dhananjaya is stuck on the crease, thanks to the length and also the pace, which gave the batsman little time to get a good stride forward, and he ends up playing well inside the line while defending
back of a length outside off, left alone
fuller now, on off stump, Mendis stretches out to defend

big appeal, and it's given! Again he's gone past the outside edge, this is brilliant bowling. Slower and flightier than the one that got Dhananjaya, and it's struck Mendis' back pad in front of middle stump as he's pressed forward to defend, opened up by the inward angle. Mendis has reviewed Paul Reiffel's decision, and the one big question is, has it pitched in line? Yup, in line with leg stump, and Mendis has to walk back for a duck
tossed up outside off, stretches out and blocks it back to the bowler
short and wide and he slaps it away to sweeper cover
tossed up on a good length on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
tossed up wider outside off now and Mathews skips out to clip to midwicket
quicker now, back of a length, and it bounces extra to hit Mathews on the thigh pad as he goes back and across to defend
back of a length outside off, goes deep in his crease to defend back down the pitch
back of a length, closer to off stump now, punched to short extra-cover
down the track and he can't get to the pitch of this one that dips at him outside off. Inside-edge into pad as he stretches out to defend, and it falls safely to the right of short leg
fuller, driven to mid-on from outside off
slows it down now, perhaps expecting Dimuth to step out again, but he instead shuffles across his stumps and scoops this with the turn to the fine leg boundary. Shot
now he flights it fuller outside off and Dimuth drives it with a full flourish, back past the bowler diving to his left
length ball closer to off stump, defended off the front foot
good length again, pitching outside off and turning in. Steps across to clip it to midwicket
goes back to a length ball straightening on leg stump, whips it to midwicket
floated up fuller on middle stump, gets forward to clip it carefully to midwicket
floated up full on middle stump again. Reaches out in front of his body to drive, the slower pace foxing him slightly, and he ends up squeezing it to deep square leg off the inside half of his bat
good length on off stump, stretches out and defends with soft hands into the cover point region
full-toss on off stump, whips it away firmly but too close to midwicket
tossed up slow and fairly full on off stump. Presses forward and lets it come to him to defend towards backward point. This has been a feature of his game, always playing close to his body
full on off stump, defended into the off side, with the turn
goes back to the quicker one spinning from middle to off, defends into the covers

ooh, this has gone to the third umpire. A possible leg-side stumping. Floated up slow and angling down leg. Pitched very full, and beat Mathews attempted flick. He momentarily overbalanced and the keeper wasted no time in getting the bails off, but he managed to keep his back foot grounded
tossed up full on middle stump, defended with the turn, getting close to the pitch of the ball with his stride
short and wide and Mathews misses out, cuts it straight to backward point
length ball straightening towards leg stump. Keeps his front pad out of the way and defends with nice, soft hands
shortish, turns less than expected so Karunaratne doesn't have enough room to cut. Chops it to backward point
loopy and full on middle and leg, Karunaratne gets quickly in position to paddle it away to fine leg
tossed up outside off, gets out of his crease quickly and drives to long-off
tossed up on off stump, clipped to mid-on
tossed up wide of off stump. Has to reach out to drive and dip and turn cause him to hit it back to the bowler instead of through the covers
line shifts onto the stumps now, stretches out to defend into the on side

big shout for lbw as he goes back and across to defend. Sharp turn from outside off, but was he struck in line? Not given out, not reviewed. Let's see. I think he was struck in line, but it turned too far to be hitting the stumps
length ball turns into middle and leg, clipped to short leg

back of a length outside off, doesn't turn. Karunaratne is deep in his crease, is able to read the natural variation off the pitch and push gently into the covers to pick up the single that takes him to another outstanding fifty
full on middle stump. Defends with his front pad out of the way, and the ball hits the outer half of his bat and rolls gently wide of slip
tossed up on middle and leg, defended back down the pitch

sharp turn from a fullish length outside off, and Mathews leaves it alone. Didn't pitch too far outside off, and Mathews didn't get across his stumps to cover them, so an arm ball could have left him looking quite silly
tossed up outside off and Dimuth puts it away, drives with the turn to the left of extra-cover. A big puff of dust as that ball landed on the surface
full, on off stump, clipped to the left of midwicket
back of a length on off stump, no turn, and he makes room to stab it to the right of backward point
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra
tossed up on middle stump, good stride forward to defend with the turn, into the on side
fuller now, on off stump, gets forward to clip gently into the on side

Maharaj spins around in appeal after Karunaratne pads one away without offering a shot. Pitched fairly wide of off stump, and I'm not sure that turned enough to hit the stumps. Not much of an appeal from anyone else
tossed up wider still, padded away again
down the track now, and that's a brilliant shot, against the turn. The footwork got him right to the pitch to drive that down the ground, to the left of mid-off
down the track again, not quite close enough to the pitch of it to go hard at his drive. Checks it and plays it back to the bowler instead
tossed up, straightens from a good length towards middle stump. Gets forward to clip it away past the right foot of short leg
full, angling down leg, clipped to fine leg
back of a length on off stump, defended towards midwicket
length ball outside off, bounces slightly more than expected as Mathews comes forward to defend. Takes his bottom hand off the handle and the ball drops down gently into the leg side
back of a length, close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
full outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length, angling into off stump, shuffles across and plays a trademark tuck off his hips to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
full, angling down leg, gets his front leg out of the way and clips into the square leg region
floated across to off stump, stretches out and defends back to the bowler

some excitement around the bat as this one spins in sharply from just outside off. Not close to the pitch as he presses forward, the ball hits the inside shoulder of his bat and pops in the air to the left of short leg
length ball on middle stump, defended into the on side
goes deep in his crease to a fairly full ball on middle stump, defends to short leg
back of a length on off stump, defended towards midwicket
short outside off, sits up for Mathews to pull to the left of deep square leg

and he's finally dismissed. Finally, someone finds a way past him. A good ball, shortish and rising in the corridor outside off, and Karunaratne jabs away from his body and gets a thick outside edge that carries low to Amla, falling to his left at slip
full outside off. Roshen didn't get enough of a stride across to drive it through cover, ends up dragging it back to the bowler, along the ground
length ball close to off stump. Presses forward, lets it come on, and guides it between second slip and gully with soft hands
bouncer rising high over off stump, Roshen sways out of the way
nice length on middle stump, defended towards short leg
full on leg stump, whipped away through square leg
lovely soft hands - he's such a natural against spin. Tossed up, spins from middle to off, and he presses forward, front pad out of the way, and simply lets ball hit bat
fuller, on middle stump, blocked into the on side
beauty. Flight and dip close to off stump, and sharp turn away, with dust flying everywhere. Beats the outside edge by a long way even as Roshen's bat goes searching for the ball
full on middle stump, driven firmly to mid-on
short, rising ball over off stump. Roshen drops his hands low and sways his uppper body out of the way
fullish outside off, good stride forward to block to mid-off
full on middle stump, shows the full face to push towards mid-on for the quick single. The fielder had to move a fair distance to his left
back of a length outside off, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended back to the bowler

this one goes the other way, a slight bit of movement away after pitching on a good length outside off. Throws his hands at it, away from his body, and the thick edge flies to the third man boundary. No gully - could have been interesting had there been one
full on middle and leg, defended into the on side
tossed up slow, close to off stump, defended with the turn
length ball on off stump, defended to silly point

gone, is it? Did it carry to slip? Lovely flight, angling into middle and leg, and the angle opened up Roshen as he came forward to defend, aiming towards mid-on. Dipped and spun to take the outside edge, but fell just short of Amla tumbling to his left
fuller, defended back to the bowler
full on middle stump, whipped to the right of midwicket
back of a length, pitching on middle and turning in. Goes back and across to work it away through square leg
back of a length again, spins into the pads, clipped down to fine leg

oh man, that was nearly bowled! He got Dhananjaya with a similar ball in the first innings. Floats it across Roshen, pitches it outside off, and gets it to dip and turn back in. Looks to whip it with the turn, leaves a big gap between bat and pad, and it spins through that gap and bounces over off stump
length ball outside off, defended towards backward point
wrong'un, pitching on leg and turning towards off. Short enough for Mathjews to go back and adjust, using his wrists to work it to midwicket
goes back to a flat length ball straightening towards middle stump, and defends it solidly to end a brilliant day for Sri Lanka
starts by drifting onto the pads and Roshen clips it away through square leg
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot and tucks it towards midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended to midwicket. He's getting a little bit of shape back into the right-hander
short outside off, pulled to deep square leg
back of a length, just outside off, defended into the point region
length ball outside off, gets a good stride forward to defend into the covers
length ball angling into middle stump, clipped watchfully to midwicket
back of a length, tailing in slightly towards off stump. Lets it come on and tucks it to deep square leg
fuller now, angling into off stump, defended to mid-off
length ball close to off stump. Plays forward with soft hands, and picks up a quick single into the cover-point region, placed that a fair way to the right of Bavuma at point
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
bouncer rising steeply over off stump, ducks awkwardly, closing himself off at the front shoulder, but manages to evade it
good ball! Some of the old Steyn venom. Short in the corridor, and gets it to rise steeply to beat Roshen's back-foot punch
back of a length on middle stump, whipped away to deep square leg
back of a length, angling into middle stump. Steps back and across and tucks it to long leg
good ball, on the fuller side of a good length in the fourth-stump channel, and gets that steep bounce again. Roshen leaves this time
back of a length on middle and off, defended to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, gets on his toes and defends downwards into the pitch

there's the breakthrough, and it comes in unfortunate manner for Roshen Silva. Run-out at the non-striker's end. It's gone up to the third umpire, but it's pretty straightforward. A full one from Rabada, outside off, and Mathews drives it hard, back down the ground. Wasn't actually heading towards the stumps - more mid-offish - but Rabada gets down to stop it and ends up deflecting it onto the stumps with his right hand. Roshen is a good way out of his crease when the bails come off
ooh, a little risky. Short outside off, and extra bounce causes his back-foot slap to go in the air, but into the gap to point's left
short again, some width. Stops on Mathews a little and his attempted punch through the covers ends up going to mid-off
back of a length, angling into off stump, clips it gently to the right of mid-on
length ball angling into off stump. Stays in his crease and defends to midwicket
fullish, close to off stump, defended to extra-cover
length ball outside off, left alone
a touch closer to off stump, punched back firmly to the bowler
looks for the yorker on middle stump and Mathews gets his feet out of the way and flicks it to long leg
greets him with a bouncer angling across to off stump. Gets on his toes and gets his hands up to fend at it, and the ball pops up off the handle but drops down halfway down the pitch
short again, on off stump, this one doesn't rise up that high and he defends to short extra
nice change-up. Slants this full and a long way wide of off stump and Dickwella throws his bat at it and misses. Steyn gives him a sardonic half-smile
back of a length outside off, keeps slightly low, squeezes it into the cover point region and sets off for a quick single. Has to hurry because Bavuma moves like a flash to his right from point
short, gets up to chest height, manages to ride the bounce and keep it down gently
length ball, angling into top of off. Looks to drive through cover without really moving his feet, ends up hitting it into the leg side with the inside half of his bat
short, angling down leg, and the line allows Dickwella to easily help it away to the fine leg boundary. Long leg was fairly square, so he had no chance of stopping it
back of a length close to off stump, punched firmly to the right of extra-cover, and Maharaj moves quickly to cut it off
yorker outside off stump. Dickwella has a poke at it but can't connect
shortish, angling into middle stump, defended to midwicket
length ball close to off stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length close to off stump, shuffles across and defends towards short extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, keeps slightly low. Hits the bottom of Mathews' bat as he jams down on it and shoots just wide of gully
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
length ball outside off and that's nicely played. No footwork, but nice hands to punch through the line, to the right of extra-cover
fullish outside off and Dickwella leans forward and opens his bat face to steer it to the left of third man

beautifully bowled, and Dickwella has to go. The threat of the short ball freezes his front foot, and Rabada angles a fullish delivery into the fourth-stump channel and gets it to straighten away. Ends up having to reach in front of his body to drive it, and gets a healthy edge through to de Kock, who takes it falling to his left
length ball angling into middle stump, tucked away through square leg

big appeal as Dilruwan pads up to one that comes back in sharply from outside off. Given out immediately, and I don't think Dilruwan is reviewing this. 150 Test wickets for Rabada! He wasn't offering a shot, so it doesn't matter if the impact was outside off stump. One doubt I have is the height - we'll have to wait for ball-tracking for that. Impact outside off, and it's comfortably hitting off stump
back of a length outside off, left alone
bouncer over off stump, Lakmal ducks at the waist and gets under it, keeping his eye on the ball
short, a bit of width, cut away to the right of third man
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of mid-off
short, gets up to shoulder height on off stump but loses quite a bit of pace off the pitch. Pulled away awkwardly to the right of mid-on
back of a length outside off, Lakmal has a waft at it and misses. Was neither trying to defend nor attack
fullish, angling into the batsman, and he plays across his front pad and prompts a big lbw appeal from Steyn. Not given, and you can see why - it was easily missing leg stump
full on off stump, stays on the back foot - probably mindful of that short leg fielder - and shuffles across to clip to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on

fullish on off stump, defended into the covers. Could have taken a single off both balls of the over so far, but he's refused them, understandably. Both fast bowlers have been on since the first over of the day, so it shouldn't be long before they go out of the attack

good ball, angling into off stump and straightening from a good length. Extra bounce too, as Mathews presses forward to defend. The edge falls short of gully, however, with Mathews dropping his bottom hand
full on off stump, clipped to the right of mid-on. Takes the single now

ooh. Short, angling into off stump. Lakmal hops across and looks to tuck it into the leg side. Closes his bat face too early and the ball pops in the air, but safely to the left of Bavuma, who's at a very short cover
into the rib cage, and he jumps up and tucks it to long leg. Have they taken the single? Looks like it. Strange. The lead is past 300 anyway
fullish, a bit of width, slashed hard to backward point
short, angling into the body but only getting up to waist height. Pulled away to long leg
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across to clip towards midwicket
shortish in the corridor, punched to the left of deep extra cover - pretty much everyone is back on the boundary
back of a length outside off, and Lakmal is either beaten or he's left this skillfully, pulling his bat back inside the line. I suspect the former
ooh, late movement in from back of a length, was coming in towards off stump but probably going over. Lakmal is late bringing his bat down to defend, and is hit on the back thigh
tossed up on off stump, driven back firmly to the bowler
tossed up on middle stump, dips a little shorter than the previous ball, gets forward and clips to short leg
goes deep in his crease to one that spins in from outside off and keeps a little low, jams his bat down to play it into the leg side
floated up slow outside off, drives a little early at it and doesn't get the power he wants, and it rolls gently down to long-off
flighted wide of off, Lakmal looks to drive away from his body and misses
sharp turn and bounce from outside off, beats Lakmal as he goes back to work it leg side. Hits high on the thigh pad and pops up to the right of slip
flat, fairly full, angled into off stump, defended off the front foot
flighted slower on off stump, and Lakmal miscues the big hit. Wanted to go over mid-off, ends up slicing it over the bowler instead, and it falls to ground 2/3rds of the way to the rope
full on leg stump, clipped wide of mid-on
tossed up close to off stump, defended with soft hands to the left of short extra
flighted ball on off stump and Mathews puts it away brilliantly. Steps away from leg stump to make some room, and lofts it gloriously over the extra-cover boundary

slow flight on middle stump. Gets his front pad away from the line to defend, and edges it towards backward point as it dips and spins away sharply. Played with soft hands, though, so the ball rolled along the ground all the way
tossed up very full outside off, doesn't have the leverage to drive so he jabs it back towards the bowler
floated up on off stump, snatches too hard at this attempted big hit and sends it rolling along the floor to mid-on, dragging it off the inside half of the bat
full again, on off stump, but a bit quicker. Blocked back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump and now Lakmal makes some room and flat-bats it to the left of extra-cover. Not the most hurried running from Mathews - they could have taken three otherwise
flighted ball on leg stump, defended to short leg
tossed up wide of off, may have been the googly. Reaches out and flat-bats to extra-cover
full on middle stump, blocked into the on side
looped up high outside off, Mathews thinks of driving but has to check himself because of the dip. Pushes it back to the bowler instead
got him. The arm ball, sliding in and hitting middle stump. Mathews cleared his front leg for the slog sweep, and once he missed, there was nothing to interrupt the ball's path towards the stumps
tossed up nicely outside off, stretches out to block it back to the bowler

there's the Herath reverse-sweep. Picked the right line for it, outside off, but was a little late on the shot and made no contact - the ball was probably a little too full for it. Beats the keeper as well
floated across to off stump, good stride forward to block into the covers
lbw appeal from Shamsi as Lakmal presses forward to defend and plays down the outside. Dipped and pitched on middle and leg, so probably missing leg stump
tossed up on off stump now and he clears his front leg to whack it down the ground, between the non-striker and the umpire

another big appeal, another not-out decision from Rod Tucker. This time South Africa have reviewed. Similar to the previous one, but the line looked more promising... Pitches on or just outside off, and beats the inside edge as he presses forward to defend. Pitches on off stump, hits in front of middle, and bounces over and misses leg stump, according to ball-tracking
flatter, and this looked like the wrong'un. Extra bounce as Herath played across it, looking to hit it to mid-on from outside off, and it hits him on the glove

sweeps from the stumps, misses, and Rod Tucker immediately raises his finger. Herath has reviewed now. It was too full and flat to sweep, I think, and the ball has sneaked under his bat. Decent stride forward, but he opened himself up, and it's hit him on the back thigh as a result. Three reds - pitching on leg stump, hit him on the back leg in front of middle and leg, and going on to hit off stump - and Herath will have to walk back
tossed up outside off, smart stride forward to defend to mid-off
short outside off, slapped to deepish point
tossed up on middle stump and that's nicely done. Cleared his front leg, knew there was no one back at long-on or deep midwicket, and launched this over wide mid-on
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
shortish outside off, flat-batted to long-off
tossed up outside off, drops onto a nice length. Presses forward and blocks into the point region
back of a length, spinning sharply down leg, just lets it hit his thigh pad
flights it now, outside off, and Lakmal clears his front leg to flat-bat between the umpire and the non-striker, Mid-off was up saving the single
looks to make room and drive inside-out but the ball dips on him and hits his pad. Pitched on leg stump, so no way that's hitting any stump in this city
and again, tries to drive inside-out. Dip and turn force him to hit it back into the pitch off the inside half of the bat
fuller now, driven to deepish mid-off
back of a length, spinning down leg, Sandakan can't connect with his flick
back of a length outside off, punched to long-off
full on middle and leg, clipped to the right of midwicket
better length now, forces him to come forward defend an arm ball sliding on towards off stump
short again, gives him width too, and he cuts it away fiercely to the left of backward point. Poor, poor bowling
tossed up slow but a touch too full on off stump, defended off the front foot
floaty full-toss angling into off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up wide of off, and that's lovely. Drives to the right of extra-cover and a long way to the left of long-off
tossed up on off stump, driven to mid-off, who's now moved up
back of a length, spinning down leg. Misses the flick and the ball hits his pad
ooh, quicker now. Goes back to the length ball spinning in from off stump and defends it back to the bowler
back of a length, spinning down leg. Misses the flick and the ball rolls to short fine leg off the outside of his pad
googly, pitches too short and outside leg stump. Clipped neatly to deep midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, pushed into the cover point region. Calls for one but has to hurry back as Maharaj closes down quickly to his right
bouncer, ends up losing his line and whanging it wide off stump
short, some width, and he opens his bat face and steers this wide of gully. Off the outside half of the bat, but it went pretty much where he intended it to go
digs it in short outside off and Steyn equals Pollock now. Gets up to shoulder height, and Sandakan pokes at it and offers a simple catch to the man at point
arm ball to start, beats Markram's attempted back-foot punch through midwicket and hits pad. Missing leg stump, though

another lbw appeal, another not-out decision, but this time Sri Lanka have reviewed. Another arm ball, this one coming in from outside off as he looks to punch into the covers. Deep in his crease, strikes him on the flap of his back pad, but impact is clearly outside off. Missing off stump too, ball-tracking says
tossed up slow on middle stump and Markram defends towards short leg

and again, lovely loop and dip on middle stump. Markram playing a very open forward defensive, his back foot going across towards slip and his front foot pointing to mid-on. Off inside-edge and towards backward square leg
this one's more on off stump, defended into the off side
tossed up slightly slower outside off, defended into the covers
length ball sliding on with the angle towards middle stump. Keeps his front pad out of the way and defends into the off side
slides on with the angle again, a little flatter. Goes back and works it through square leg
back of a length, pitching on off stump and spinning in. Goes back to clip to short leg
flatter, shorter, goes back and tucks it to leg gully, on the bounce
tossed up full, slanting across to off stump. Leans forward and eases a push into the covers
length ball pitching outside leg and turning further down leg. Padded away, no shot offered
tossed up slow and wide of off, landing in the rough. Drives away from his body and misses - didn't turn
flatter, closer to off stump, defended back to the bowler off the front foot

again that wide line attacking the rough. Dangled up slow, and Elgar sweeps - a risky shot anyway but he's also early on it. He's lucky the top-edge lands in no man's land at short fine leg, almost behind the keeper
on off stump, flicks and gets an inside edge to leg slip
full outside off, defended into the off side
wide outside off, left alone
tossed up, turning in towards middle and off. Presses forward to defend and gets a thick inside edge to backward square leg
flatter now, though not necessarily shorter, goes back and defends to short leg
slow flight fairly wide of off, dipping onto a good length, stretches out and defends

big appeal for caught at leg gully. Just off pad. Didn't get anywhere near the pitch of this one turning in sharply from outside off as he stretched his front foot out. Beat the inside edge and popped up off pad
sharp turn again, and this time he just pads it to short leg
down the track now and Dilruwan floats it wider and fuller. Squeezes it out to the right of backward point
tossed up slow outside off, lands on a full length, pushed to the right of mid-off
ooh, beauty. Flighted ball, angles in towards off stump but dips much shorter than Markram expects as he strides forward to defend and rips past his outside edge
fuller, blocked back to the bowler
down the track and he fails to reach the pitch of this one outside off. Jabbed out to cover

nice flight again, drifts in towards off stump. Markram defends in that open manner again, back leg sliding across and pointing towards slip, and gets a thick inside edge that rolls away through backward square leg
length ball turning in towards off stump, defended towards mid-on
back of a length, spinning in towards off stump. Punches, looking for mid-on, but midwicket moves in quickly to intercept
nice length, dips and turns in towards off stump, defended into the off side
a little slower and slightly wider, waits slightly longer and defends into the off side
down the track but can't reach the pitch of this ball. Dips sharply on a middle-stump line and he clips to mid-on
flatter length ball on middle stump, defended back down the pitch

gone! That's a poor choice of shot from Elgar. Ran down the pitch, ended up nowhere near the pitch of the ball. I think he just went too early, and Dilruwan bowled a flat offbreak just outside off stump, which beat his desperate attempt at lofting down the ground - he was reaching a long way in front of his body - and left Dickwella with the easiest of stumpings to complete. Wow, they belatedly show a replay of the bowler's front foot, and it's landed on the white line without any part of the heel behind. He got a wicket like this in the first innings too.
tossed up slow outside off, blocked back to the bowler
flat and fairly full on middle and off, defended into the on side, with the angle
floated up wider outside off, and Markram leaves it alone
back of a length outside off, punched to backward point
tossed up on off stump, gets back and across to cover the line and defends with the turn from a low crouch
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away through square leg
a touch short on off stump, makes a bit of room and punches this through the covers
flat length ball turning from off to leg. Goes onto the back foot to defend to short leg

taken! Brilliant from Dhananjaya de Silva at leg gully. Classic offspinner's dismissal. Flight, dip, turn and bounce. Draws Amla forward to defend and he's nowhere close to the pitch of the ball as it spits at him from outside off. Inside-edge onto pad, and it pops up in the air to the left of leg gully. Dhananjaya takes a couple of quick steps to his left and completes the low, two-handed catch with a sprawling dive, From the side-on angle, you can see Amla's barely come forward. Looked like he stretched out, but his back foot was so deep in his crease that his front foot was only a foot or so in front of it
back of a length, spinning into leg stump, stays back and tucks it to backward square leg
fuller now, on middle stump, gets forward and clips to mid-on

ooh, beauty. Flights this slow and wide of off and Bavuma does well to go back and across, picking the length despite the loopiness of the trajectory. Then it goes with the angle rather than spinning in, and beats the outside edge
slider, angling into middle stump. Goes back and works it through square leg
down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, defended to mid-on
dips onto a good length on off stump and straightens, blocks it back to the bowler. Again that back foot slides across
full outside off, defended towards short extra-cover
nicely played. A bit slower than the previous one, and lands just that bit shorter, but he presses forward, waits for it, and defends under his eyes
down the track now and he goes for the big hit over mid-off. Doesn't get hold of it and skies it high over extra-cover, but drops down safely before anyone can turn around, chase, and get to it
flat on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up wider and he stretches out to defend. Gets his pad outside the line, which helps him because it spins back in and beats his inside edge
beaten in the flight again. Stretches out to drive through mid-off and inside-edges through midwicket
down the track now, gets close to the pitch and clips wide of mid-on
big shout for a caught-behind off glove. Was there any contact? Went for the sweep and it turned sharply and bounced, probably went over the top of his glove. Sri Lanka don't review
fuller now, outside off, gets forward for a checked drive into the covers
full on middle stump, defended into the covers, keeps his front pad out of the way
drifts in this time and keeps going with the angle towards off stump. Defended off the front foot, into the covers
fuller now, on middle and off, blocked again into the covers, keeping his front pad out of the way
similar trajectory to the previous ball but wider outside off. Gets his front pad across now and defends

well bowled, he's playing with Bavuma's front pad here. This one's a little higher in trajectory, drops on a good lenght again but a little closer to off stump. Plays for more turn than there is and inside-edges into his pad
more round-arm now, gets it to slide in towards off stump, defended into the covers
shortish outside off, chopped down into the point region
ooh, risky. Tossed up wide of off, inviting the cover drive. Takes the invitation and goes at it away from his body. Inside-edges towards midwicket
a little closer to off, reaches out to defend into the covers

got him! Flatter trajectory, closer to off stump, but perhaps not short enough to go back to. Rips in sharply and takes the inside edge as he looks to defend, and leg slip takes a good, sharp catch. Went straight to him but quickly, and only at knee height, and he stayed low and made it look simple
ooh, wow. Drifts away along a wide line outside off, pitches,and continues to go away from the batsman. Good thing he shouldered arms there
and now du Plessis edges one. The offbreak, turning in quickly from outside off. Plays slightly inside the line in defence and I think that fell just short of Mathews at slip

this one certainly carries. A nice, low catch at slip. Typical Herath dismissal. Nicely flighted outside off, draws Faf forward to defend, but he finds himself not near enough to the pitch of the ball to defend safely. Just enough spin away to take the edge, and Mathews does the rest
back of a length outside off, doesn't turn that much. Goes back and across to defend
down the track now to a flighted ball outside off. Closes his bat face early, looking to clip through midwicket, and gets a thick edge that runs away wide of slip
tossed up again and he clears his front leg and sweeps it over the square leg region
back of a length, turning in towards off stump. Goes back and across and works it towards backward square leg
full now, on middle stump. Gets his front leg out of the way and clips to midwicket
tossed up outside off, nice stride forward to defend
the floater that continues to go with the away-drift. Back of a length outside off and he pokes it away defensively
flighted ball on middle and off, defended into the on side
flat now, angling into the pads. Goes back and clips to short leg
flights it wide outside off, presses forward and pushes to the left of extra-cover
nice length, this, angling into off stump and going with the angle after pitching. Plays a bottom-handed drive that rolls towards mid-on off the inside half of the bat
Dickwella goes up in appeal but Herath doesn't, as this slides on with Markram on the back foot, trying desperately to flick it away. Thick inside edge into pad

both openers are out stumped, and Herath goes past Pollock and Steyn. Dangled up slow outside off, and Markram thinks he can jump out and reach the pitch. He doesn't, and ends up flaying desperately at it as it spins away and beats him
flat length ball sliding on towards middle and off. Stays back and defends into the off side
draws him forward now with flight, and it drifts in in the air and keeps going in that direction as he pushes at it with an open face. Thick inside edge to backward square leg
quicker now, length ball angling into off stump. Goes back to punch to mid-on
skids on from a middle-and-off line and Philander's feet go nowhere as he jabs at it, playing for turn. Hit on the pads but it's sliding down leg
there's the sweep again, from off stump, and it's just past the outstretched fingertips of Herath's right hand as he throws himself at it from backward square leg
tossed up full, close to off stump, blocked into the covers

appeal for lbw as de Kock misses the sweep against the one that goes with the angle from round the wicket. Tucker raises his finger, and de Kock reviews. De Kock is in trouble here because he didn't really get his front pad across. He cleared it slightly to make more swinging room, and that means impact must have been in line with the stumps. Let's see now... Yup, in line with off stump and hitting middle and leg. Ends the innings of someone who had no confidence in his defence

big appeal again as he goes back and across to defend one that rips in from outside off. Tucker shakes his head, and Sri Lanka review. I think it's struck him in line, but is it bouncing too much? Impact in line with middle and off, flicking the top of the leg bail, so it stays with the umpire's decision, a fair one
big sweep now, misses, and Dilruwan bellows out another appeal. Struck outside the line, I think

goes for another sweep, and the ball spins from middle stump, misses bat and clips the outside of his front pad and rolls down to the short fine-leg region. Umpire signals byes - maybe there was no pad
goes back to a flat length ball on middle and leg, defends to short leg
a little slower along the same line, gets his front pad out of the way and defends back down the pitch
a bit quicker, on off stump, hurries Philander into his defensive push with the turn. Had to get that pad out of the way quickly

down the track now, steps away from the line to try and loft over mid-off. ends up slicing it over extra-cover instead, and Dimuth, running back to his left, gets both hands to the ball but can't hold on.
quicker now, fired in towards middle and leg. Goes back to whip it away through square leg
ooh, lovely change of pace. Slower, loopier, definitely more overspin, and it dips, turns, and bounces to comprehensively beat Philander as he reaches away from his body to defend
tossed up wide of off, flat-batted powerfully to the right of mid-off. A rare overpitched ball from Dilruwan
down the track now and this time he whips it with the turn, flat and on the bounce to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, no turn, goes back to whip it to long-on
goes for the sweep again, and misses. It pitched outside off, and the impact was outside as well
sweeps again, and this time the length is slightly fuller and in his arc. Hits it hard and flat through square leg
back of a length, ends up just outside off stump. Goes back and chops to backward point

tossed up, drifts in a little from wide of the crease as Herath bowls with a lower arm. Philander pads it away and Reiffel raises his finger almost as soon as Herath appeals. Philander reviews. Will that hit off stump, or did it turn just enough to miss? Impact was outside off, but that doesn't matter. The degree of turn is what's important here. Turned a bit, I'm afraid, and Mr. Reiffel will have to overturn his decision
drifts in again, fuller and pitching on off stump. Looks to get his pad out of the way and defend and squeezes it into the on side off the inside edge
arm ball now, hurries into Philander off the pitch and beats him as he hurriedly plays across the line. Hits pad, but this one's certainly missing leg
tossed up wide of off stump and now Philander skips out and launches it with the spin over long-off
lovely length, straightening towards off stump. Defended to silly point, off the outside half of the bat
a slight bit quicker on a similar line, this one hits the inner half of the bat, doesn't turn as much

there's the five-for. It was coming, given the kind of shots Maharaj was playing. Down the track now, swings at it and hits it with the turn, straight to deep midwicket. Sandakan backtracks while taking it at chest height, and nearly overbalances over the rope, but manages to stay inside the line
length ball going with the angle towards off stump, defended towards mid-on
shorter and wider, left alone
flighted on leg stump, clipped off the front foot to backward square leg
quick and flat, pitching just outside off and turning quickly away. Defended into the covers off the back foot
back of a length, slides on with the angle and beats Rabada's inside edge and hits front pad. He'd opened up, though, and even the impact must have been outside leg stump
full on off stump, blocked to silly point
tossed up again, drifts in further towards off stump. Defends off the front foot and the ball rolls to midwicket off the inner half of the bat
another slider, this one's flatter and quicker. Goes back and blocks towards midwicket

appeal for a catch at silly point. Was it a bump ball? It's all happening, and it's gone to the third umpire. There's also the possibility of pad first. Soft signal is not out. He clearly defends it into the ground, and the big screen flashes not out. They don't check for whether it hit pad before bat, though - I have a feeling it did.
down the track and makes room to drive inside-out. Drift makes him inside-edge into his front pad
another arm-ball. Curves in from outside off, pitching just back of a length. Reads the line well and leaves it alone
ooh, another slider from round the wicket. Plays back to a length ball and he gets a thick inside edge that bounces down to short leg as he jams down in defence
tossed up fuller, defended into the covers
good length, going with the arm again and hits front pad as he comes forward to defend. Missing leg
sharp turn now, from outside off. Goes back to defend and it easily beats his outside edge

what a follow-up! The previous one spun away from pretty much the exact same spot and Rabada was beaten, playing away from his body. He leaves this one and it just keeps going with the arm, brushes the flap of his pad and hits off stump. Beautifully bowled
dips onto a nice length outside off, stretches out and defends it back to the bowler
flighted and full, drifting into middle stump. Keeps the front pad out of the way and defends inside-out
fuller still, driven back to the bowler
another round-arm arm ball that slides in towards off stump. Stays in the crease, watches it off the pitch and defends
a bit fuller, comes forward and defends inside-out once more

that ball was coming, seeing how careful Philander was being with keeping his front pad out of the way. This is looped up wide of off stump, and Philander uses the swinging room to launch it high over mid-on
flatter and quicker outside off, presses forward and defends into the point region

strides forward to a tossed-up ball outside off, defends to the right of midwicket off the inside half of the bat. He ambles the first half of his single and has to hurry to beat the direct hit at the bowler's end
goes back to a length ball angling across and straightening towards off stump. Blocks it back to the bowler
a touch shorter, goes back and defends gently into the cover region
flighted ball wide of off. Gets a big stride across to defend
tossed up a little closer to off stump, a little slower. A little early on the cover drive, ends up needing to use his wrists to keep it down
length ball spinning in towards off stump. Gets his back foot across to cover the line and then presses forward to defend into the point region
length ball angling in and straightening slightly towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler

there's No. 3 for Herath. Full on middle and leg and Steyn drives a little too early, without a stable base, as he looks to pull his front pad away from the ball and bring his bat down through the line. Hits it hard, though, and Herath catches it two-handed just over his head. An excellent reflex catch
ooh. Full, drifting in towards off stump. Shuffles across instead of coming forward, and defends slightly outside the line. Inside-edge flies to the right of short leg

back of a length outside off, and Herath gets some extra bounce to surprise Philander. Shapes to cut and checks his shot as the ball gets big on him. He's lucky that pops up to the left of backward point and not straight to him
goes back to a length ball on off stump, defends to silly point
back of a length on off stump, some extra bounce again. Defends with soft hands to backward point
dangled up slow, outside off. Shamsi's a little late coming forward to defend, and it spins sharply to take the inside edge
flatter, and he shuffles across and pats it back down the pitch
appeal for lbw as Shamsi plays across this one in defence. Bat comes down at an angle from gully, and the ball beats outside edge to hit pad, but he'd shuffled across and the impact was outside off
flatter length ball, defended with the turn
Shamsi has no idea where the ball will go. Floated across to off stump and he shuffles across to defend. Goes with the arm and beats the outside edge
shuffles again rather than come forward or back. This one turns in from just outside off and he gets an inside edge into pad
flat, back of a length, straightening towards leg stump. Goes back to work it through midwicket
slow length ball outside off. Shamsi shuffles across and leaves
full, round-arm, slides down the leg side as Shamsi misses the flick
ooh, falls just short of silly point. Roshen dives forward as Shamsi defends one in front of his pad, bat coming down from gully. Hits the outside half of the bat and drops down towards silly point
shuffles across again to defend. The ball doesn't turn, passes inside edge and pops up to short leg off the pad
back of a length, slides on towards middle stump. Shuffles across and manages to work it behind square
flat at the pads. Clips it on the bounce to leg gully
slower now, pitches outside leg and spins further down, sharply. Left alone
this one straightens on middle stump. Shamsi somehow brings his bat down in front of pad and defends into the leg side
down the leg side again, left alone
back of a length wide of off. Shuffles across and defends into the point region
doesn't come forward at all, does he? Shuffles across to a pretty full one on off stump, clips it towards leg gully
full, close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, spins in from outside off, goes back and across to work it through square leg
big spin from middle and leg, turns a long way down the leg side
wrong'un, straightening towards middle and leg. Shamsi - he bowls left-arm wristspin too - seems to pick it, defends towards silly point

big appeal for lbw. Paul Reiffel isn't interested. Sri Lanka review. Shuffled across again and the bat came down from gully, as always. This was the googly, beat the outside edge of his defensive bat and hit back pad. Pitching just in line with off stump, straightening to strike just in line, and it will - according to ball-tracking - go on to hit off stump. Reiffel has to overturn his decision, and Sri Lanka win by 278 runs
